description: This wine opens with spicy cinnamon and clove aromas before diving into soft, dark fruit, mellowed tannins and oak. It's brooding and zippy at the same time, and on the balanced finish, it's all mocha.
title: Fenestra 2008 Ghielmetti Vineyard Petit Verdot (Livermore Valley)

description: This has notes of raspberries, cherries and whipped cream. It's addictively drinkable, showing none of the problems Grenache so often encounters. Enjoy it now for its fresh, irrepressible appeal.
title: a-non-ah-mus 2009 Alisos Vineyard Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

description: What a wonderful wine to pair with spaghetti alle vongole or calamari fritti. Made from Grechetto grapes and aged only in stainless steel, this is fresh, youthful, tangy and crisp, with aromas of citrus, kiwi, honeydew and peach.
title: Arnaldo Caprai 2011 Grecante Grechetto (Colli Martani)

description: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo wines are making steady gains in popularity in foreign markets thanks to the softness and the creaminess of their fruit flavors. This one has soft and yielding tannins, with aromas that are intensely redolent of black cherry, coffee and tobacco.
title: Cantina Zaccagnini 2008 Chronicon  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

description: This is a unique wine from Mallorca with light cherry and raspberry aromas. Clampy, dry and tannic on the palate, it's full of savory, roasted barbecue flavors along with tomato and red fruit notes. Very Mallorcan in that it's salty and savory from start to finish.
title: Ànima Negra 2009 ÀN/2 Red (Vi de la Terra Mallorca)

description: There's a touch of dark spice and cured meat at the start that is followed by fruitier notes of blackberry and plum. This shows smooth tannins and nice richness, making it a good pairing partner to potato gnocchi with gorgonzola cheese sauce.
title: Benincasa 2007  Montefalco Rosso

description: Pachàr is a blend of organically farmed Chardonnay, Viognier and Sauvignon that offers bright aromas of citrus, peach, pineapple and blanched almond. Pair this pretty wine with rice-stuffed zucchini or tomatoes.
title: Fattoria Lavacchio 2010 Pachàr White (Toscana)

description: Very crisp, clean and polished, this is an easy white wine to enjoy with friends and grilled fish. It's redolent of cut grass, citrus, peach and white almond.
title: Monteverro 2011 Il Nostro Vermentino (Toscana)

description: This smells familiar and solid, with blackberry, licorice and dark cherry aromas. It feels medium bodied for a high-end Argentine Cabernet, with healthy acidity and probing tannins. The flavors of blackberry and raspberry finish crisp and slightly citric.
title: Pascual Toso 2009 Alta Reserve Barrancas Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: The fruit carries a pleasing sweetness onto the herb-flavored midpalate. Then aggressive flavors of stem and grape skin emerge, though perhaps they're too dominant.
title: Rex Hill 2009 Roserock Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is as crisp and dry as a whispy reed, with a mild grassy note on the nose. It feels fresh and focused, with lime, peach and apple flavors. Fruity, fresh and easy to like from start to finish, this is what a Best Buy should be.
title: Segura Viudas NV Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)

description: This Sagrantino by the relatively new brand Tenuta Castelbuono (owned by the same family that runs Ferrari sparkling wine) opens with savory notes of cured meat, blackberry and tobacco. It feels rich and spicy on the finish.
title: Tenuta Castelbuono 2006  Montefalco Sagrantino

description: A whiff of leather introduces this tight, interesting, southern Oregon Syrah. Black fruits, iron filings, and smooth tannins mark a wine made from grapes that were carefully selected (just three rows of vines) and given special consideration by winemaker Herb Quady.
title: Troon 2008 Reserve Syrah (Applegate Valley)

description: Dark in color and slightly bashful at first, this blend of Syrah, Sangiovese and Merlot shows strength in its solid structure, with bright aromas of red cherry, blackberry, leather and cured meat. It would pair perfectly with stewed game meat, like wild boar.
title: I Giusti e Zanza 2009 Nemorino Red (Toscana)

description: This is an earthy wine that packs ripe fruit with structure and acidity. There is a juicy character from the red berry flavor that is given shape by the underlying tannins.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2010 José de Sousa Red (Alentejano)

description: A dry, gritty red wine, lusty and tannic. The blackberry, cassis liqueur and smoky oak flavors suggest pairing with charred steak.
title: Wattle Creek 2009 Malbec (Alexander Valley)

description: Though it was given twice as many new French oak barrels as the Estate bottling, this Vintage Select could be its twin. Solid and balanced, it mixes berry, herb and earth components, making for a well-structured, no-frills wine.
title: Witness Tree 2010 Vintage Select Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Despite some tough tannins on the finish, this is an intriguingly complex wine that may prove even better than this rating suggests. It starts with a garrigue note and a hint of tapenade, then adds bright cherry fruit and plenty of dusty tannins. Drink 2014–2020.
title: André Brunel 2009 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

description: Crisp and refreshing, this blend of 85% Chenin Blanc and 15% Viognier is high in acidity with a creamy midpalate. Guava is most notable flavor, followed by kiwi and honey. Oysters would be a good call.
title: Vinum 2012 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (Clarksburg)

description: Named after the stagecoaches that used to travel through the Médoc, this château has produced an attractive, fruity wine in 2011. It has some tannins and firm wood-aging flavors, while the fruit is light and fresh. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Patache d'Aux 2011  Médoc

description: Aromas include black berries, coffee, espresso and grilled Mediterranean herbs. The one-dimensional palate lacks the essential fruit richness needed to support the bracing, astringent tannins that give a drying, bitter character. It also displays evident alcohol sensations despite the modest alcohol.
title: Cordella 2009  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Oaky and earthy, this estate Mourvèdre is on the savory side of things, ripe in stewed plums, tobacco and black pepper, linear and soft. Barrel-aged for a year in French oak, 20% of it new, the wine's oak imprint should continue to mellow with time.
title: David Girard 2010 Estate Vineyard Mourvèdre (El Dorado)

description: Whole-cluster pressed, with 20% Marsanne in the blend, this displays fresh fruit flavors of apple and pear, with a bit of somewhat dilute green banana. There's a slightly waxy aspect to the mouthfeel; overall this is a simple, pleasant, clean but generic white wine.
title: Eleven 2012 Elephant Mountain Vineyard Roussanne (Yakima Valley)

description: The prune and raisin scents and flavors suggest that some of these grapes were picked past optimal ripeness. For those who favor an almost Port-like style, this Bordeaux-style blend will hit the mark. The finish suggests figs lightly splashed with balsamic vinegar.
title: Elsom Cellars 2008 Isabella Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Earthy and herbal, this inexpensive Pinot offers faint cherry tones and a structured, juicy midpalate. The wine's pronounced tannins take center stage on the finish.
title: Girasole 2011 Pinot Noir (Mendocino)

description: With a touch of apricot fuzz and fresh-cut grass, the wine is high in acidity and clean, bright and layered.
title: Hannah Nicole Vineyards 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Contra Costa County)

description: Crème caramel and spice aromas are exotically appealing on this bright, full-bodied Chardonnay. Dry in style with zesty acidity and fresh apple flavor, the palate is a bit more subtle than the nose, but makes this a straightforward drinker.
title: One Woman 2010 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Brambly red berry and sour cherry notes are fleshy and ripe in this brawny, full-bodied Bordeaux-style blend. It's unabashedly primary in style with soft, plushy texture. Finishes with a bit of heat.
title: Sannino 2010 Prima Rossa Red (North Fork of Long Island)

description: The winery has a track record for producing Chardonnays that are very appealing, though not particularly complex. This wine is rich in tropical fruits, pears and peaches, with buttered toast and vanilla notes, wrapped into a buttery, creamy texture.
title: Black Stallion 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: In this one-dimensional wine, short-lived sensations of stewed black fruit quickly give way to acrid notes of unsweetened espresso, farmyard, sweat and green coffee beans alongside rough, grainy tannins. A bitterly tannic close leaves the tongue feeling parched.
title: Bonacchi 2009 Molino della Suga  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: This serviceable red blend includes smaller amounts of Merlot and Syrah, with tart red fruits and drying tannins. It dries out the mouth with a chalky sensation, suggesting it would be best enjoyed with red meat.
title: Mercer Canyons 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: New oak dominates this Chardonnay, giving it strong flavors of buttered toast and butterscotch. The acidity is pronounced, and there are ripe mango and pear flavors, but it remains a simple wine.
title: Michael Pozzan 2012 Annabella Special Selection Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Starting off quite reductive, it opens to reveal notes of lime leaf, mineral and freshly peeled tangerine. The palate drinks dry but doesn't have the acid to entirely stand it up.
title: Pacific Rim 2012 Wallula Vineyard Biodynamic Riesling (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: A good-value Petite Sirah that's straightforward in texture and personality. Its blueberry fruit lurks shyly in the background and there's a send-off of sturdy tannin on the finish.
title: Parducci 2010 Small Lot Blend Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

description: A scent and flavor of vitamin pill pervades this attenuated wine. The fruit hovers around flavors of rhubarb and pomegranate, and the overall impression is that the wine needs more time to pull itself together.
title: Patterson 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This very light, thin Merlot shows modestly ripe fruit and fairly substantial tannins, perhaps from the addition of 16% Petit Verdot. Flavors are herbal and the finish fades quickly.
title: Patterson 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This older vintage Syrah still has some fruit but otherwise shows drying tannins and leathery smoke.
title: Riverbend 2007 Estate Bottled Syrah (Humboldt County)

description: Spicy, slightly sweet foods will pair well with this easy-drinking Viognier. Its flavors range from mangoes and oranges to honey, vanilla bean and cinnamon. Chinese and Thai fare will be ideal.
title: Sculpterra 2012 Estate Viognier (Paso Robles)

description: Whiffs of smoke and dust add a savory tone to delicate flavors of apple and honeydew rind on this dry, zesty wine. It's medium bodied on the palate with refreshing lemon-lime acidity.
title: Silver Thread 2012 Doyle East Seneca Vineyard Riesling (Seneca Lake)

description: This Cab, ripe as it is in cherries, black currants and dark chocolate, nonetheless is too soft in structure. It has a melted mouthfeel. The finish suggests caramelized wood. Drink up.
title: Summerwood 2010 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Ripe, jammy orange, lime, apricot and mango fruit flavors join with buttered toast and vanilla flavors to make for an opulent, yet simple, Chardonnay. Brisk acidity provides balance.
title: Testarossa 2012 Dahlia Dijon Clones Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a stalky, black currant and spice flavored wine. It has relatively soft tannins while showing a meaty, juicy character. The wine is for medium-term aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Château d'Escurac 2011  Médoc

description: An attractive, if lightweight, wine that has good acidity and red berry fruits. It is a medium-term wine, fresh and developing quickly.
title: Château Léo de Prades 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: This is an enormous wine, maybe too much. With its layers of rich black fruits and dark tannins, it is a powerful, juicy, jammy and super-ripe wine. It all seems excessive and out of balance. It's fun for a moment, but not for drinking with food.
title: Château Roullet 2010  Canon-Fronsac

description: With layers of new wood and spice flavors, this wine is highly structured without much fruit to balance. It will develop into a dry, firm wine, showing light black fruit flavors surrounded by textured tannins.
title: Château Tour Prignac 2011  Médoc

description: This was 40% barrel-fermented, and carries a whiff of oak in the aroma. Apple scents and flavors follow. It's fresh, forward and fruity, with simple, straightforward flavors.
title: Mercer Canyons 2012 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: An aromatically interesting wine with notes of cherry, cedar and nori. The palate is flavorful with dry, rustic tannins.
title: Naches Heights 2010 Naches Heights Vineyard Syrah (Naches Heights)

description: Melon and white-fruit aromas are more generic than specific. This has a lively, fresh mouthfeel, along with flavors of nectarine, melon and persimmon. A lasting finish has a racy feel but offers nothing more in terms of flavors or complexity.
title: Raimat 2012 Castell de Raimat Albariño (Costers del Segre)

description: Flamboyantly rich and manipulated Chardonnay, with buttered popcorn, tropical fruit and caramaelized toast flavors. Feels a little heavy-handed, but lots of Chard lovers will like it.
title: Mi Sueño 2008 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Spiced meat, tomato leaf and stemmy black fruit overwhelm this wine, which might unfortunately be a bit past its prime. 69% Merlot, 27% Cabernet Franc and 4% Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Oak Valley 2005 The Oak Valley Blend Red (Elgin)

description: Plump, sweet and creamy in texture, with apple and citrus flavors that offer simple, straightforward pleasure. Good quality, impressive for the 50,000 cases produced.
title: Clean Slate 2009 Riesling (Mosel)

description: Fairly hard on the nose, with a hint of plastic and then raspberry and plum aromas rising as it settles. The palate shows decent zest and body along with narrow flavors of berry and pepper. Finishes with mild intensity and a note of saline.
title: Emiliana 2009 Natura Merlot (Rapel Valley)

description: Some awkward flavors and textures in this dry, tannic wine. Polished blackberries and cherries co-exist beside less ripe mint, and the tannins and acids are sharp and green. Seems like problems at the sorting table.
title: A.S. Kiken 2008 Red (Diamond Mountain District)

description: A blend of typical Gascon grapes gives a lemon and citrus wine, very fresh, tangy. There is plenty of acidity and an attractive lightness. Screwcap.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2009 Villa Beaurivage White (Vin de France)

description: A good, everyday sipper, soft and gentle, with appealing flavors of pineapples, oranges, pears, cream and buttered toast. Could show greater structure and acidity.
title: Somerston 2009 Highflyer Grenache Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Light and delicate, this “Vintage Debut” Pinot Noir skates along a pretty thin edge. Light hints of strawberry and cherry blossom lead into a pale wine with plenty of acidity. But despite the acclaimed vintage, this is pretty thin stuff.
title: Amalie Robert 2008 Vintage Debut Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A clean everyday Gewürztraminer, showing the variety's spicy flavors, with hints of pineapples and candied ginger. Tastes off-dry and crisp in acidity.
title: Bargetto 2008 Gewürztraminer (Monterey County)

description: Confusingly, the wine has no connection with Château Magnol, also owned by Barton & Guestier. It's a soft Médoc wine, light and gentle in character, the tannins soft, merging with the red berry fruits.
title: Barton & Guestier 2008 Les Charmes de Magnol  (Médoc)

description: Tight wine, its black currant flavors layered with dry tannins. It's finely structured, although the stalky element tends to dominate. Not for aging.
title: Barton & Guestier 2008  Médoc

description: If more Americans are drinking wine from a box, it's because of values like this 3L, the equivalent of four regular bottles. The wine is dry, smooth and flavorful, and the blackberries, herbs and spices are pleasant.
title: Bota Box 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: A curious, dirty nose doesn't help this wine. The palate is certainly better, its fruit now mature, smooth, the acidity blending with attractive smoky flavors.
title: Château Pimpine 2005  Bordeaux Côtes de Francs

description: Close to Fronsac, this is a Merlot-dominated wine that has soft, ripe fruit. It shows sweetness and open berry flavors touched by chocolate and licorice. To be   opened over the next 2–3 years.
title: Château Saint-Michel 2008  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This easy food wine (a blend of Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon) offers aromas of wild berry and white almond. There's a nice balance between crispness and a touch of sweetness on the close.
title: Drei Donà Tenuta La Palazza 2009 Rosenere Red (Forlì)

description: This is a dessert wine because it's frankly sweet in honey, sugared pineapple tart and lemon pie filling flavors. With crisp acidity, it's a nice sipper, clean and delicious. It's the best sweet Moscato at this price in California.
title: flipflop 2010 Moscato (California)

description: Soft, sweet in jammy raspberry and cherry fruit and caramelized oak, this Syrah is somewhat simple. It's good, but would benefit from greater structure.
title: Baldassari Family Wines 2007 Nolan Vineyards Syrah (Bennett Valley)

description: A wine that offers plenty of the charm of Margaux, with its soft tannins, layers of chocolate, smooth texture and juicy fruit. The wood at this stage is prominent, and needs to settle down.
title: Barton & Guestier 2007 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Margaux)

description: Jammy and yet still savory, a fairly straightforward Syrah from the Clements Hills area of Lodi, small production (240 cases), 100% varietal and made using native fermentation, the wine has solid tannin structure and a heady texture, but could use more oomph on the finish.
title: Borra 2008 47.5 Degree Limited Release Syrah Syrah (Clements Hills)

description: Rather hard and baked on the nose, with a heavy helping of char and molasses. The palate is angular and tannic, while the flavors revolve around lemony oak and spice more than fruit. Spiky on the finish and sharp-edged as a whole. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère, Malbec and Syrah.
title: Botalcura 2006 Cayao Red (Central Valley)

description: Not a ton of fruit on the nose but a respectable single-vineyard from Zin master Carol Shelton made from organically grown, dry-farmed 92-year-old vines, coaxed into a spicy, brambly wine from a very unusual appellation.
title: Carol Shelton 2008 Monga Zin, Lopez Vineyard Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)

description: A soft, open wine, kept together by its dry tannins. Good black fruits, fresh acidity and an attractive smoky character.
title: Château Monroze 2008  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Purple in color, with grapey aromas that lack complexity. The palate is deep and dense but edgy, with sugary flavors of candied black plum and black cherry. Finishes sweet like burnt brown sugar, with some coffee and anisette. Syrupy but generous.
title: Chilensis 2009 Reserva Malbec (Maule Valley)

description: With its few years' aging, the wine exhibits a Chenin Blanc nutty quality backed by the greater weight of Chardonnay. Full-bodied, ready to drink. Screwcap.
region_1: Vin de Pays du Jardin de la France
title: Domaine des Baumard 2006 La Calèche Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Vin de Pays du Jardin de la France)

description: Not in the same league as Donelan's Syrahs. The Grenache seems to drag it down. It's paler in color, there's a vegetal smell, and it's simple in berry, cola and spice flavors. Drink now.
title: Donelan 2008 Cuvée Moriah Grenache-Syrah (Sonoma County)

description: Soft red apple, hard peach, green fig and underripe banana peel all marry with an underlying yellow floral note. Light and easy in the mouth with a short but clean finish.
title: Ken Forrester 2009 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: Smells and tastes slightly sour, with simple flavors of pineapple and citrus that finish with a tart edge.
title: Bush Bike 2005 Unoaked Chardonnay (Western Australia)

description: The palate is big and cushioned, but the flavors are green, stewy and herbal. With carob and some veggies on the finish, there isn't convincing ripeness to this wine.
title: Bodegas Valdemar 2003 Inspiración Edición Limitada  (Rioja)

description: Strawberry, red plum and a strong hint of tomato leaf work the nose, followed by tangy raspberry flavors and a wash of acidity. Seems sort of scratchy and edgy, with a hard, dry peppery quality.
title: Campo Viejo 2003 Reserva  (Rioja)

description: St. Helena is the source of this blend of Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Entirely unoaked, it's a dry, crisp, rustic wine, and full-bodied for a rosé, with heavy flavors of cherry pie filling.
title: Casa Nuestra 2007 Home Vineyard Dry Rosado Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: There's earthy, fleshy aromas on this wine that has acidity, red fruits and soft tannins. The rough edge of rusticity is not far away, though, spoiling the fresh fruits.
title: Château Saint-Sulpice 2005  Bordeaux

description: Despite plenty of weight in the mouth, this wine's simple apple and lime flavors are surprisingly crisp, turning nearly sour-lemony on the finish. Imported by Walca International.
title: Red Earth 2007 Chardonnay (Adelaide Plains)

description: After a string of successful vintages, this wine has an oven-baked fruit taste, like blackberry and cherry pie-filling that burbled out from the crust and got caramelized.
title: Rocca 2004 Syrah (Yountville)

description: Yellow in color, with floral, citrusy aromas. Not a whole lot of definition to the palate; it's wet but dilute, with unrefined, nonproprietary citrus flavors.
title: Valsanzo 2005 Viña Sanzo Verdejo (Rueda)

description: Tightly wound and acidic, with forceful red-berry flavors that are spicy and zesty. Finishes a little on the raw side, with cranberry notes and a hard crescendo. Tempranillo with Garnacha and Cabernet.
title: Bodegas Julián Chivite 2004 Gran Feudo Crianza Red (Navarra)

description: Has some Viognier and Sémillon for added richness, but there's still a pretty powerful blast of raw, green gooseberry that's less than ripe. There are also tiers of figs, melons and vanilla.
title: Tamayo Family 2006 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Roble means “oak” in Spanish, and oaky it is. The nose is creamy and candied, while the palate is soft, sticky and mixes raspberry with butter-like flavors. When people say they don't want too much oak on their basic wines, this is what they mean.
title: Bodegas Monte La Reina 2005 Torcanto Roble  (Toro)

description: They left a lot of sweetness in this steel-fermented Pinot Grigio, so if you like that sugary edge, this one's for you. The flavors are of vibrantly ripe tangerines, pineapples and fresh green apples.
title: Donati 2006 Pinot Grigio (Paicines)

description: Hard and mossy, and not bearing much resemblance to Cabernet as we know it. This wine has thickness and a creamy definition, but also lean fruit flavors that hint at raspberry and cranberry.
title: Señorío de Sarria 2004 Viñedo No. 9 Cabernet Sauvignon (Navarra)

description: Condensed up front, with aromas of berry compote and molasses. So why is this so tangy and tart in the mouth? Maybe the grapes weren't as ripe as they seem from the nose, and in the end it fails the all-important balance/wholesomeness test.
title: Hemar 2006 Joven  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Zingy and sort of floral on the nose, but fairly pickled, less than pure fruit mars the flavor profile. White wine from La Mancha has never been a Spanish strong suit, and while this wine isn't cloying, sharp or dead on arrival, it doesn't add up to much.
title: Finca Antigua 2006 Blanco Viura (La Mancha)

description: Gumball aromas yield to scents of spice and wet animal fur, while the flavor profile settles on tart and thin, with a watery mouthfeel. This is a lean, funky wine that doesn't have a whole lot of Rioja character.
title: Bodegas Valdemar 2006 Esencia Valdemar  (Rioja)

description: Rustic, barnyard aromas with flavors of hedgerow red berries and light acidity. The style is fruity; the sweet fruits are shot through with some licorice and beetroot flavors.
title: Château du Bousquet 2005  Côtes de Bourg

description: A little rough around the edges, with some green tannins and minty, herbal flavors. You get some candied cherries and currants, but the wine is pretty rustic.
title: Hayman & Hill 2005 Reserve Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: From the fine Spring Mountain appellation, this has sweet-and-sour flavors of apricots, pineapples and brown sugar.
title: Keenan 2006 Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)

description: A brittle, peppery and ultimately disappointing wine, this 100% varietal lacks the smoothness and cherry-herb complexities you expect from a fine Rutherford Cab. Finishes sharp and dry.
title: Conn Creek 2004 Conn Creek Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: Soft and earthy, with dried herb and blackberry flavors tinged with smoky oak, this is a gentle Cabernet for drinking now. It has enough fanciness to partner with a nice steak or an upscale beef taco.
title: Gundlach Bundschu 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: A soft, ripe rosé, this is on the sweeter side of brut. It also has a flavor of bottle maturity that blends easily with attractive crisp acidity and a fragrant rose hip character. It is ready to drink.
title: H. Blin NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Wheaty and yeasty on the nose, this becomes clearer and more focused on the palate and finish. The mouthfeel is round and solid, while the flavor profile folds in a maderized tone, with cherry and raspberry notes and mild bitterness.
title: Miguel Torres NV Santa Digna Estelado Rosé Sparkling (Chile)

description: Edgy plum and berry aromas come with an herb accent, a spice note and a flower element. It comes across high in acidity, with shearing plum and cherry flavors that end with a feeling of citric acid. It's crisp and intense, but also tight as nails.
title: Morandé 2008 Edición Limitada Carignan (Loncomilla Valley)

description: This fragrant Falanghina shows bright aromas of white flower, jasmine and honeysuckle. Very subtle tones of banana and pineapple fill in the back and give the wine momentum and depth on the finish.
title: Orion Wine 2010 Rocca del Dragone Falanghina (Campania)

description: Fresh and informal, this opens with tangerine aromas, followed by notes of passion fruit, citrus and white flower. It's easy and fresh, with tonic bubbling on the close.
title: Orion Wine NV Rosa Bianca Brut Sparkling (Veneto)

description: Rustic and full bodied, this Oregon Primitivo is plenty ripe, yet it retains nuances of olive and herb, along with thick red fruit. A whisper of smoke weaves through the finish.
title: Pheasant Valley Winery 2009 Primitivo (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: Oscar Quevedo is one member of a new generation of winemakers bringing a breath of fresh air to the Douro. His everyday wines, like this one, are friendly, fruity and delicious when consumed young. This is a great wine for barbecue.
title: Quevedo 2010 Oscar's Tinto Red (Douro)

description: On its own, this is dry and earthy, with a taste of Middle Eastern hummus, apricots and oranges. It's certainly offbeat, but it can certainly be paired with food. How about hummus with teriyaki salmon?
title: Spann Vineyards 2010 Betsy's Backacher White (California)

description: A rich, earthy mushroom note adds a rustic flair to this dark, ripe, full-bodied red. The palate is a shade sanguine, with hints of game and plum conserve and a ripple of velvety tannins. It's developing beautifully, so drink now–2015.
title: Telavi 2008 Satrapezo Saperavi (Kakheti)

description: Brisk minerality and a hint of hazelnut add savory tones to this blend of indigenous Georgian Rkatsiteli and Chardonnay. It's dry and full-bodied, yet surprisingly sprightly, with bright acidity and delicate flavors of stone fruit and citrus rind.
title: Telavi 2010 Marani Rkatsiteli-Chardonnay White (Kakheti)

description: There seems to be a bit of residual sugar in this wine, just enough to offset the searing acidity. Some nice flower notes highlight the aromas, with flavors of tart peach and citrus filling in the rest.
title: Hyland 2011 Riesling (McMinnville)

description: Mainly Pinot Noir, with just 15% Chardonnay, this full-bodied bubbly has notes of seemingly sweet raspberries. The mouthfeel is slightly coarse. Still, it shows plenty of elegance, and if you're toasting the wedding couple, it's just fine.
title: Iron Horse 2008 Wedding Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: An attractive salmon color introduces this crisp and fruity wine. Lively and full bodied, it has bright acidity, as well as fresh strawberry flavor. It's dry, dominated by youthful acidity. It will benefit from a few more months in bottle.
title: Jacquart NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: This is unmistakably a mountain-grown Merlot, hefty with dark fruit and layers of baking spice. Concentrated and ready to age another 5–7 years, it has a long and leathery finish.
title: Lava Cap 2009 Merlot (El Dorado)

description: This runs to the tart, lemony style of Pinot Gris, common in cool vintages. Citrus and gooseberry flavors are balanced against refreshing minerality, and the acidity is neither harsh nor simply sour.
title: Acrobat 2011 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

description: Soft, juicy and uncomplicated, this Cab Franc immediately offers likeable cherry and sweet oak flavors. The tannins beg for steak.
title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2010 Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)

description: This wine's crusty, minerally aromas of black fruit are lightly toasted and earthy. On the palate, it feels tannic and high in acidity, with roasted, earthy flavors of plum and raspberry. Concentrated and grabby on the finish, it has a touch of lemony oak and astringency.
title: Apaltagua 2010 Signature Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: This roasted and rustically pleasing Montepulciano, which is hard to find in California, has dry tannins, a layer of boysenberry and a leathery mouthfeel. Pair it with roasted chicken or rich risotto.
title: Bella Piazza 2009 Montepulciano (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: This is a popular and reliable wine to pair with desserts or to drink alone. It offers foamy mousse with peach and honey on the finish.
title: Beni di Batasiolo 2011 Bosc Dla Rei  (Moscato d'Asti)

description: A touch of apple skin immediately appears on the bouquet of this wine, giving this hearty selection a bright, sharp quality. The apple tone is followed by notes of dark chocolate and espresso bean.
title: Cantine Benedetti 2008 Corte Antica  (Recioto della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Made principally from organically-farmed Aglianico grapes, this delivers steady aromas of ripe fruit, prune, tobacco and cured meat. The mouthfeel is lean, bright and slightly bitter.
title: Tormaresca 2008 Trentangeli Red (Castel del Monte)

description: The bouquet is dense, smoky and rubbery, with powerful meat and berry notes. It shows vitality as well as mild choppiness on the palate, with tobacco, lemon, balsamic vinegar and black fruit flavors. Mildly herbal, it is somewhat creamy and good overall on the finish.
title: Vistamar 2010 Sepia Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: A well-balanced Chardonnay, this has flavors of tropical fruit, apricot and lemon candy, brightened by that famous Edna Valley acidity. This would make for a great apéritif.
title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2010 Wolff Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This opens with an oily note that's soon replaced by generic white peach and apple scents. It feels plump, with chunky flavors of citrus, kiwi and lime, and it's mild yet fairly long on the tail end.
title: Piggy Bank 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

description: Full and fat, this has an oily, ripe fruit texture—a sign of its warmth and richness. It's a food style of wine, with apricot and pear flavors that are round and generous. Drink now.
title: Quinta das Bandeiras 2011 Passagem Branco White (Douro)

description: This is an oak-aged wine full of ripe red-plum and highly toasted wood flavors. The two do not yet completely harmonize, with the burnt wood still dominating the fruit. Another year should do the trick.
title: Quinta do Quetzal 2008 Guadalupe Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Firm and obviously wood aged, this has a red plum flavor and some bitterness from the highly toasted wood. It has richness and spice; aging may soften the wood character.
title: Quinta do Quetzal 2010 Guadalupe Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Despite its name, this is in fact a rosé, which is light orange-pink in color. It is bone dry, mineral, taut and crisp. Red currant and lime flavors mingle with a tight acidity and totally dry aftertaste. Disgorged June 2012.
title: René Geoffroy NV Blanc de Rosé Extra Brut  (Champagne)

description: Hints of baking spice, smoke and black coffee add kick to the sweet black-plum and cherry flavors on this full-bodied red blend. It's a big, luscious wine, with abundant vanilla and toasted oak notes, but hints of fresh herb and peppery black spice add balance.
title: Sauska 2008 Cuvée 7 Red (Villány)

description: Initially this smells green and candied, with overripe and underripe aromas. The palate is chunky and bulky, while flavors of black fruits and green herbs finish grassy, with notes of oregano and tarragon. Overall this is heavy, extracted, sweet and sticky.
title: L'Atzar 2012 Red (Priorat)

description: This intense, slightly sour Zinfandel combines herbal/menthol aromas with a taste of vanilla-toasted marshmallow, the fruit jammy and minty.
title: Mazzocco 2011 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

description: Fresh raspberry and cherry aromas are bright and fresh on this dry, dusty-pink rosé. It's crisp with acidity and juicy with tart, red-fruit flavor, but there's an earthy, savory tone that lingers throughout.
title: Ravines 2013 Dry Pinot Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: There's lemon curd and apple in this straightforward, light Chardonnay. Cradled in oak and vanilla, it is mid-weight in both texture and body, and a good value for the price.
title: Sebastiani 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: The tawny rim of this ruby-red Cabernet Sauvignon hints towards signs of early evolution. It's maturity is more evident on the palate with somewhat demure flavors of dark cherry, cedar and herb accented by touches of autumn leaf, soil and mushroom. Drink up now.
title: Standing Stone 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Finger Lakes)

description: Concentrated in pleasing pear and stone fruit, the toasty oak and oily richness of this wine detracts from the fruit. It comes into its own with some air, the texture showing more acidity and balance.
title: Waterstone 2012 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Red violet in the glass, this blend of 85% Öküzgözü and 15% Cabernet Sauvignon has a nose of butterscotch and black cherry. Flavors do not coalesce completely, with cool notes of menthol and clove prevailing over flavors of tart cherry, raspberry and a hint of iodine.
title: Diren 2010 Red (Turkey)

description: If blackberry preserves and black licorice were made into a wine, this would be it. While Yarden's T2 dry blend of Touriga Nacional and Tinta Cao is a very good wine, this sweet Port-style wine misses the mark. With a nose of blackberry preserves, cassis and rose petal—and flavors of blackberry, cassis, licorice and clove—it should be gorgeous in the mouth. However, the overall sweetness is cloying without necessary balance.
title: Golan Heights Winery 2009 Yarden T2 Touriga Nacional-Tinta Cao Red (Galilee)

description: There is no varietal specificity to be found in this 100% Cabernet Franc. A wine labeled Barrel Select brings certain expectations, which this fails to meet. It's thin and herbal, with stemmy tannins and only a bare suggestion of black cherry fruit.
title: Vin du Lac 2010 Barrel Select Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Very soft and dull, it offers white fruits and some acidity. Drink now.
title: Louis Latour 2012 En Paradis  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: Floral, dusty aromas are encouraging, but this is overly citric and aggressive on the palate. Lemon, underripe stone fruit and minerally flavors turn tart and pithy on the finish.
title: Luna Beberide 2013 Godello (Bierzo)

description: There's a hard edge to the mocha, herb and cherry aromas. The palate has blocky, dry tannins that distract.
title: Samson 2012 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Aged in stainless steel, this faint SB is herb-y and slightly grassy. Sweetness on the midpalate sticks around before the quick finish.
title: Sebastiani 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

description: Wheaty, flat aromas are indicators that this is losing its luster. The palate is chunky, with melon, mango and canned peach flavors. Best to wait for a newer vintage.
title: Serra da Estrela 2012 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

description: Jumpy, young aromas of wet dog, plum, cherry and beet root set up a racy, high-acid palate. This tastes like medicinal raspberry and red plum, while the finish is light, scouring and fresh, with no oak character.
title: Godelia 2012 Viernes Mencía (Bierzo)

description: Pollen and dusty mineral tones lend earthiness to melon and lychee aromas on this off-dry Gewürztraminer. Medium bodied in style, it balances tart tangerine acidity with a round, rich mouthfeel.
title: Heron Hill 2012 Reserve Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

description: Dusty aromas comprise the dull nose on this bottling. Once sipped, there isn't a lot of distinct flavor, save for some blackberry notes. It will work for a backyard barbecue of ribs and saucy chicken.
title: Bridlewood 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This off-dry Riesling boasts pretty fresh apple and floral notes on the palate, but persisting notes of dried herbs and spring ramps distract. Sprightly on the palate with delicate lemon acidity.
title: Four Degrees of Riesling 2012 1st Degree Medium Dry Riesling (Seneca Lake)

description: Ruby in color yet delicate in extract, this blend of Zweigelt and Lemberger is a concession between a red and rosé wine. On the palate, bright red-berry flavors are layered in unusual tones of caramel and spice. The label suggests it can be served both chilled and at room temperature.
title: Shalestone 2013 Beyond Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: An easy-drinking, weekday type of red wine that is smooth and light in texture and body, and modestly flavored with notes of plum and dried herbs.
title: Twin Arches 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: The wine is candied and sherbet-flavored. Acidity gives some freshness, but it feels artificial and light.
title: Manuel Seguin 2012  Viré-Clessé

description: A soft, simple style of Cabernet with mild cherry and strawberry flavors, light tannins, smooth texture and light- to medium-body. The flavors fade quickly on the finish.
title: Silver Spoon 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Funky aromas of animal fur and lively berry are not that inviting. In the mouth, this has a narrow feel and high acidity. Herbal, tart flavors of plum and red currant are almost sour, while the finish is on the green and herbal side.
title: Cruz de Piedra 2013 Garnacha (Calatayud)

description: Tarry, stalky aromas fail to make much of a statement. This is high in acid and rugged in the mouth, with a mixture of herbal red-fruit flavors and distinct stalkiness. A grating finish is racy and hot.
title: Bodegas Ateca 2012 Honoro Vera Garnacha (Calatayud)

description: Animal hide and roasted, stalky aromas bring overall quality into question. This feels raw, choppy and drawing, while flavors of stalky berry fruits are leathery and roasted. Hard tannins and green notes influence the finish.
title: Bodegas Reyes 2011 Tamiz  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Dilute red fruits and a tomato paste flavor are the story here, with no varietal character. Some earthy, roasted barrel flavors come up but are not well-integrated.
title: Vin du Lac 2011 Red Café Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Pipe tobacco, raspberry reduction and a sweet sagebrush character promise an interesting experience. Once sipped, the overwhelmingly sweet cherry, cough-syrup flavor pushes this wine beyond a dry, and the typical Cabernet Franc herbs that emerge in the midpalate don't overwhelm its cloying nature. Good for dessert, by itself.
title: Savannah-Chanelle 2010 Estate Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Dusty mineral tones and pressed apple aromas lend a savoriness to this dry, full-bodied Grüner Veltliner. The palate boasts a fresher fruit profile, with bright apple and lemon flavors that wrap up briskly on the finish.
title: Stony Lonesome 2012 Estate Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

description: Notes of rhubarb and cherry don't stitch together. It drinks just off dry with a tart finish.
title: Cave B 2013 Dry Rosé Merlot (Ancient Lakes)

description: Stony minerality blends with raisin, leather and leafy berry aromas. This offers cheek-stanching citric acidity but not enough body to absorb it. Flavors of herbal red plum are choppy and turn gritty and fiery on the finish.
title: Idrias 2007 Sevil Red (Somontano)

description: Thick and rich with tobacco and dark chocolate notes, this vineyard-designated wine shows a generous helping of brambly black fruit, its midpalate baring the teeth of sharp tannin and smoky oak. It finishes soft and contained.
title: Hawley 2015 Ponzo Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

description: One of the few examples of wine made from roter, or red, Riesling, this slightly salmon-hued bottling showcases the variety's characteristically berried perfume. It's taut with acidity yet satisfyingly full in body, offering generous layers of sour-plum, berry and red-apple flavors. The finish is tinged by a lingering hint of caramel.
title: Baron Knyphausen 2015 Roter Riesling (Rheingau)

description: This rock-solid Carignan feels raw and snappy. Its ripe cassis, prune and vanilla aromas are heady but not overtly oaky. Lightly herbal plum and black cherry flavors finish dry and tannic, with a cool-vintage sense of freshness.
title: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2013 Anayón Cariñena (Cariñena)

description: Sourced from Bucher Vineyard on Westside Road and Platt Vineyard in the Sonoma Coast, this wine is light-bodied and fresh on the palate, offering baked raspberry, cardamom, clove and forest flavors.
title: Ramey 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine delivers a full-figured spectrum of flavor and texture, including apple, pear and honeyed caramel notes. Supportive oak plays nicely in the background as the finish winds down softly.
title: Reata 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Well, who thought Chenin Blanc would end up in the Alentejo? Obviously not the guardian of the wine rules, which is why this classified as a mere table wine. However, the grape, perfumed and ripe in this warm climate, still weaves its magic to give a very fine wine with tropical fruit, a touch of honey and fine crisp acidity at the end. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Ribafreixo 2016 Connections Chenin Blanc (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Soft and packed with oak spice, this 100% varietal wine from a selection of sites shows rich blackberry and tobacco flavors. It has power, an approachable structure and a rich, layered, long-lasting finish.
title: Rodney Strong 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: This bottling offers key lime, golden apple, preserved lemon and honeysuckle touches on the nose, proving quite delicate despite its yellow, oxidative-seeming color in the glass. Buoyant acidity kicks off the palate, which is smooth with candied lemon peel and yellow peach flavors.
title: Saint K 2016 Luna Matta Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Paso Robles)

description: Heady aromas of white spring flower, white stone fruit and crushed herb take center stage on this fragrant white. On the succulent palate, notes of white almond and thyme underscore white peach, lemon drop and yellow apple alongside fresh acidity. A savory mineral note suggesting saline graces the lingering finish.
title: Selva Capuzza 2016 San Vigilio  (Lugana)

description: Sun-baked earth and smoke tones lend savory complexities throughout this vibrant auslese. The palate is unctuously ripe, full of fleshy, sweet peach and apricot flavors, but it's keenly balanced with racy acidity and those earthy, dusty mineral tones.
title: SJ Montigny 2015 Kreuznacher Kauzenberg Auslese Riesling (Nahe)

description: Bosc pear, tart apple and vanilla bean elements make this a fascinating dry wine. Although the aromas are inviting, the first sip tastes austere. But as it opens, the palate and gains more concentration and complexity, proving sophisticated, layered and nuanced.
title: Skinner 2015 Smithereens White (El Dorado)

description: With its inviting apple blossom aromas, this wine is fleshy and bright, showing balance and complexity from start to lengthy finish. Lemongrass, nutmeg and wild vanilla flavors tease in the background.
title: Sleeping Giant 2014 Buena Tierra Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This old-school blend of Merlot, Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon shows ample body and flavor in its unfussy approach to succulent red fruit and subdued tannin. Moderate in build, it has dusty acidity and a soft finish that will please a wide range of palates.
title: St. Francis 2014 Claret Red (Sonoma County)

description: Black cherry flavor stars in this full-bodied, brawny and expressive red that's thick with jammy fruit and interwoven tannins and oak.
title: Sutro 2013 Warnecke Ranch Merlot (Alexander Valley)

description: Scents of citrus blossom, honeysuckle and white stone fruit delicately lead the way on this vibrant white. The bright refreshing palate offers Bartlett pear, creamy white peach and a hint of tangerine.
title: Tenuta Roveglia 2016 Wighel  (Lugana)

description: This golden hay-colored wine opens in a complex floral arrangement of honeysuckle and apple blossom before unleashing a weave of apricot and lychee fruit. The acidity is tart and high-toned.
title: Tessier Winery 2016 Catie's Corner Viognier (Russian River Valley)

description: The Huber Vineyard is one of the few places where this grape grows in America, and the wine is always fascinating. Extremely dark in color, it offers unctuous black currant, graphite and licorice aromas. The palate combines mouth-coating tannins with a surprisingly light, acid-driven frame, showing woody elderberry flavors and the grape's telltale minty lift. Not extremely complex, but a fun and different sipper.
title: Tower 15 2015 Dornfelder (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The nose has rich hints of dried lemon peel while the palate shows fresh lemon zest. The flavors on the slender but concentrated body are pure and very fresh. This is just dry and totally focuses on lemon flesh and zest. Wonderfully fresh and enlivening.
title: Willm 2016 Cuvée Emile Willm Riesling (Alsace)

description: Waxy pear flavors ride a lush texture of supportive acidity in this rare white from dry-farmed vines planted more than four decades ago. Food-friendly and light on its feet, it's the perfect picnic wine, ready for charcuterie and cheese.
title: Y Rousseau 2016 Old Vine Colombard (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a ripe wood-aged wine that has a smooth rich texture. It is rounded with dominant toastiness as well as perfumed fruit. The wine has a cool edge that comes from the influence of the Atlantic while bringing out a ripe apple and apricot character. Drink this wine now.
title: Adega Mãe 2013 Terroir Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Earthy iron, game and thyme aromas decorate the core of pomegranate fruit in this California heritage clonal selection from the Sanford family's home vineyard. Dark raspberry notes follow its firm line of acidity, framed by a grippy tannic texture despite its light body. Drink 2018–2024.
designation: Mt. Eden Clone El Jabali Vineyard
title: Alma Rosa 2014 Mt. Eden Clone El Jabali Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Aromas of beeswax, orchard fruit and a whiff of hazelnut lift out of the glass. Made without added sulfites, the bright round palate delivers mature yellow apple, white peach, lemon zest and a hint of white almond alongside fresh acidity. Its understated character will definitely appeal to lovers of reserved elegant whites.
title: Ancilla 2016 1909  (Lugana)

description: Sun ripened mirabelle notes entice the nose and continue on the palate, where they are joined by an earthy edge as well as a pervasive lemon freshness. This is slender and fresh, dry and very energetic. The finish is lip-smacking and moreish.
title: André Kientzler 2015 Riesling (Alsace)

description: From various sites across appellations, this well-made red offers soft, smooth tannins and full-bodied ripeness, the flavors defined by cherry, vanilla, oak and clove. It's ready for steak.
title: Arrowood 2014 Sonoma Estates Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

description: This is a richly structured wine. With its juicy red fruits and generous structure, it is delicious now. Berry flavors and acidity go with the mineral edge of the texture to create a wine that is packed with acidity, tannins and fruit. Drink now.
title: Casa da Passarella 2014 Tinto Red (Dão)

description: Grapefruit, crushed tomato vine, exotic fruit and aromatic herb are some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant white. The elegant medium-bodied palate delivers green melon, citrus and white peach alongside a vibrant saline note that energizes the finish.
title: Castelvecchio 2015 Sauvignon

description: Still very young, this is a Maison Bouey wine with good potential. It offers hints of the ripe yellow fruits and richness that will come as it develops. The touch of perfumed spice means it is also a wine to savor as an apéritif.
title: Château Lestruelle 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Flavors roll from cranberry to sweet red cherry in a red-fruit riot. It was aged in 52% new and 24% one-year-old oak, but it's unobtrusive and not especially toasty. The barrel time has begun to smooth out any bumps and rough edges, though a touch of phenolic bite remains. Drink from 2018 to 2022.
title: Chehalem 2014 Ridgecrest Vineyards Reserve Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: Plump black raspberry and blackberry notes mix with vanilla and baked licorice on the fruit-driven nose of this blend of 67% Cabernet Sauvignon and 33% Syrah. The tannic tension and strong acidity of the palate overwhelms the flavors at first, eventually revealing dark purple fruit and a vanilla-laced finish.
title: Cloak & Dagger 2013 The Assassin Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: Made in a full-bodied and fleshy style, this comes from an estate vineyard long owned by the producer. Cloudy, with a distinct fresh cherry aroma, it opens with leathery tannins and pronounced oak notes before its bright, citrus-like acidity settles in.
title: Clos du Val 2015 Gran Val Vineyard Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: A delicate but earthy nose shows aromas of hibiscus, pencil lead, sagebrush and bay leaf. The palate packs a bright vibrancy, showing flavors of tart cranberry, crushed black pepper, clove, more sagebrush and juniper. This is action-packed but lightly framed.
title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2012 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Lemon notes are subdued by earth on the nose but they shine on a rather textured, palate that needs some air to open up. There is concentration at the core and generous freshness that lights up everything. Subtle but totally worthwhile with a clean lemon finish.
title: Domaine François Schmitt 2014 Pfingstberg Grand Cru Paradis Riesling (Alsace)

description: The wine is rich and concentrated for a Muscadet. With intense fruits and acidity, it is deliciously fruity and crisp. There is a tangy texture that gives the wine zest and minerality. The aftertaste is so fresh and zingy.
designation: Les Trois Versants Vieilles Vignes Sur Lie
title: Domaine Martin 2014 Les Trois Versants Vieilles Vignes Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)

description: Swirls of penetrating peach and honey flavors pack a mighty punch in this dazzling, sunny sip. Off dry in style, it's an easy going yet elegant wine accented by saffron, blossoms and reverberating tangerine acidity. Drink now through 2017.
title: Dr. Hermann 2014 H Riesling (Mosel)

description: Salt, chalk and grapefruit-pith aromas make for a judiciously restrained approach on the nose of this wine, which comes from heritage clones. The palate is mineral-driven with white rock flavors as well as green apple and lime-pith notes.
title: Tolosa 2013 1772 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This is so fresh and crisp with an attractive mineral character that points up the crisp apple flavors. There is a fine touch of citrus acidity as well to enhance the freshness of the wine. It is delicious, bright and refreshingly light.
title: Monmousseau NV Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

description: Bread, apple cider and yeasty complexity grace the nose on this Brut Nature. A smooth palate is now mature, ready and doesn't scrape or scour. Dry stone-fruit flavors blend with apple notes in front of a bready, toasty finish that has seltzer-like crispness. Drink through 2020.
title: Agustí Torelló 2007 Kripta Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: Aromatics of raisin and earthy tobacco breathe complexities as this airs out. A balanced but ripe and mouthfilling palate holds deep flavors of blackberry and cassis. Loamy berry, fig and chocolate flavors provide pleasure on the finish. Drink through 2018.
title: Bueyes 2012 Malbec (Uco Valley)

description: Firmly tannic, this is the rare example of a lower-priced wine that deserves some time in the cellar. There's a sense of coolness and restraint to this wine at first. Hints of menthol lift scents of mixed berries, then develop on the palate into sturdy, chewy fruit flavors and mocha. Drink 2018–2030.
title: Thorn Clarke 2013 Shotfire Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz (Barossa)

description: A superb value, this drinks way above its price. Buttery apple fruit is bedecked with cinnamon and buttressed with refreshing mineral-drenched acids. A nice hint of toast avoids any suggestion of clumsiness or artificiality.
title: A to Z 2014 Chardonnay (Oregon)

description: Ripe plum and violet aromas carry a slight note of prune. A beefy palate shows hard tannins but nothing too tough that food can't tame. Blackened, roasted blackberry and blueberry flavors finish with charred, meaty intensity. Drink through 2020.
title: Alvarez de Toledo 2013 Roble Mencía (Bierzo)

description: Produced from a single clone—Dijon 777—this offers pretty, fragrant raspberry scents and flavors. It's just rounded out enough for ready drinking. A fairly light wine, it fades gently with a saline minerality.
title: Arbor Brook 2013 Estate 777 Block Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This has well-integrated herb and stem components around spicy red fruits. It punches through into a tight, well-built finish, with smooth, clean tannins. Another couple of years in bottle may help to fill it out.
title: Aubichon Cellars 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Built around a core of acidity, this wine conveys a preponderance of cedar and sage, seemingly influenced by a softer variety like Merlot, of which it has 12%. Plum and black currant provide the fruit component, before a sizably tannic finish.
title: Bright Angel WInes 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Generous, fully ripe fruit flavors and an easy, melting texture make this wine easy to sink into. While it's full bodied, every sip delivers lively acidity and supportive tannins to give an appetizing grip and help the flavors continue through the finish.
title: Castello di Amorosa 2013 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This is less opulent and full bodied than most Australian Viogniers, but it still delivers an attractive blend of white peaches, citrus and baking spices. It's crisp and bright enough on the finish to handle a wide range of seafood dishes. Drink now.
title: Mr. Riggs 2013 Generation Series Mrs. Viognier (Adelaide)

description: This crisp, medium-bodied wine showcases Cabernet's hallmark cassis fruit. Sure, there are hints of cranberry, raspberry and cherry, but black currant defines this wine, running from start to finish. Dusty tannins swirl gently on the palate, combining with tart acidity to offer just the right amount of structure. Drink now–2025.
title: Vasse Felix 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)

description: Dark ruby in the glass, this wine offers a fruit-laden bouquet of blueberry and raspberry. It is bright in the mouth, and firm tannins allow flavors of black cherry, blueberry, cassis, clove, anise, violet and chocolate to shine on the palate. The bright finish is marked by lingering notes of violet and clove.
title: Yatir 2010 Syrah (Judean Hills)

description: Complex and fascinating aromas suggesting cranberry, cedar and mushroom get your attention right away. Next a tight, firmly tannic texture takes over and seems to hold on to the fruit flavors. The wine is light to medium in body, and seems likely to let its flavors out after 2019.
title: Hirsch 2012 East Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Faintly spiced, ripe apple and pear notes on the nose are mellowed by gentle, barely-there sweetness on the palate. This is rounded and pliable, but without an ounce of fat. A balanced, gently spiced wine with deep but slender richness that finishes dry.
title: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2013 Furstentum Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: Established in the early 70s by Ed O'Keefe Jr., this Michigan winery remains in the family to this day and maintains the founding father's focus on producing wines from 100% vinifera grapes in a region where hybrids might be the easier option. Perseverance pays off in this delightfully balanced dry Riesling that seamlessly blends juicy peach, pineapple rind and a vein of talc-dusted citrus. Texturally round and soft, with a peach-fuzz feel, this is a veritable steal for the price.
title: Chateau Grand Traverse 2013 Dry Riesling (Old Mission Peninsula)

description: This fascinating wine comes from one of Oregon's highest vineyards, which grow at 2,000 feet. Superdense and impenetrably black, the fruit is steely and detailed, the flavors of black raspberries defined with crystal clarity.
title: Dobbes Family Estate 2012 Fortmiller Vineyard Syrah (Rogue Valley)

description: Mellow, rounded and ripe notes of fresh and baked apples promise a rich wine. The palate is more sprightly and lends plenty of gingery, peppery spice to all the abundant apple fruit. This is wired and lively, dry but very fruity and unusually spicy with a fine backbone of bright, lemony freshness. Drink soon.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2012 Frankstein Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Rich perfumes reach the nose: quince and baked apple give a seductive tone. The palate strikes with the same richness but is dry. There is concentration and earthy power against a backdrop of freshness and fruity charm.
title: Domaine Gresser 2014 Wiebelsberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: With time, fresh rose petals merge into heady Turkish delight notes on the nose. This is full-on Gewurztraminer with all the bells and whistles: utterly decadent rose water and honeysuckle notes are submerged in rich, indulgent sweetness. This is perfumed and full-on: a super-charged varietal expression with rich, powdery layers of rose, honey and caramel.
title: Domaines Schlumberger 2011 Cuvée Christine Vendanges Tardives Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: Named after the mistress of Portugual's King João V who lived at this estate, the wine is a super-ripe expression of the warmth of an Alentejo wine. It is a powerful, structured although the tannins are surrounded by ripe berry and damson fruit flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2011 Amantis Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Whiffs of spice and slate lend complexity to plump, sunny peach and yellow plum flavors in this off-dry Riesling. It's fruity, approachable and easy, yet elegantly balanced.
title: Dr. Hermann 2014 Ürziger Würzgarten Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Juicy streaks of grapefruit and pineapple in this spry, dry Riesling are cut by laser-focused acidity and rocky edges of slate. It's approachable and fresh yet abundantly elegant. Drink now through 2018.
title: Dr. Loosen 2014 Dr. L Dry Riesling (Mosel)

description: A blend of 70% Friulano, 15% Ribolla Gialla and 15% Malvasia, this is perfumed with scents suggesting yellow flower, apple, citrus fruit and hazelnut. The vibrant palate is loaded with verve and finesse, offering peach, Golden Delicious apple, sage, fennel and a hint of candied tangerine zest. A note of bitter almond closes the tangy finish.
title: Edi Keber 2014 White (Collio)

description: This is an unexpected wine, unoaked Baga in the Alentejo rather than its home territory of Bairrada. The result is a wine that certainly hasn't lost its fierce tannins while gaining a rich, full black fruit character. The typical acidity is there, again mitigated by the warmer climate away from the ocean. It's a surprisingly impressive wine to drink now.
title: Fitapreta 2013 Baga ao Sol Baga (Alentejano)

description: Tart berries, a touch of maple syrup and some orange peel on the nose open into a dry black-cherry palate and lean mouthfeel. Sharply austere.
title: Cennatoio 1995 O'Leandro Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: Very floral aromatics mark this distinctive effort; it's positively overflowing with rose petals. Turns more musky and spicy in the mouth, before fading away a little abruptly.
title: Palmer 1999 Gewürztraminer (North Fork of Long Island)

description: The nose offers a full, interesting blend of Oriental spice, cherry, ginger and soy elements. The flavors turn to tart cherry, and brisk, slightly drying tannins show on the finish.
title: Nando 1998  Chianti Classico

description: Toast aromas accent ripe pears and golden-delicious apples in this soft, easy-to-like Chard that only lacks a bit of depth. A slightly bitter note on the finish should become less noticeable over the next few months.
title: Martha Clara 1999 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: A blended white, but predominantly—you guessed it—Chardonnay. The soft, sweet pear aromas and flavors are simple and clean, making this a decent quaffer on a hot summer day.
title: Hargrave NV Chardonette/White Blend Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Opens with a complex nose of cherry, plum, cocoa and leather elements that promise much. On the palate, however, it turns much more tart—even sharp—with mild cherry fruit and a light body. Finishes with modest length and a sour cranberry-herb note.
title: Tiziano 1999  Chianti

description: The red cherry fruit bears some mushroom notes among the cedar and clove accents, and there's a sense of hollowing-out that should not be evidenced at this age. It's light, showing some nice berry and spice flavors and a sweet woodiness. But it's too developed now for a 1997 riserva.
title: Piccini 1997 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: Boasts slightly oily rose and lychee scents that leave no doubt as to what grape variety you are smelling. This is a big-boned wine with a healthy alcohol level, but one wishes for more persistence on the finish.
title: Bedell 1998 Gewürztraminer (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Opens with solid grape and red-currant fruit accented by tobacco, but on the palate the wine is light for a Petite Sirah, usually a hefty wine. As the fruit is from very young vines, it's not a terrible surprise, and it's a positive sign that Israeli winemakers are stretching their horizons. Finishes tart-sweet, with red berry fruit and a hint of licorice.
title: Carmel 1999 Valley Wines Petite Sirah (Shomron)

description: A lightweight Pinot that's actually marketed as a rosé, this wine nevertheless manages to pack in decent flavors of apple skin, red berries and cinnamon, capped off by some leathery, meaty notes.
title: Hargrave NV Fleurette Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Peach and faint berry flavors in a light, crisp rosé with just a hint of residual sugar. A versatile picnic wine that's a cheerful copper hue to boot.
title: Corey Creek 1998 Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: A lightweight Pinot that's actually marketed as a rose, this wine nevertheless manages to pack in decent flavors of apple skin, red berries and cinnamon, capped off by some leathery, meaty notes.
title: Castello di Borghese NV Fleurette Pinot Noir (North Fork of Long Island)

description: A lightweight bordeaux style blend that's best slightly chilled as a stand-in for Beaujolais or Bourgeuil.  Berry fruit, with some light tannins that turn a bit green on the finish.
title: Castello di Borghese NV Petit Chateau Red (North Fork of Long Island)

description: As much as we like the retro package, this time the contents are just too one-dimensional. The heavily toasted oak over the narrow fruit from the '98 vintage reads as just that—toast, with vanilla and coconut shadings. Dry powdery tannins mark the taut finish.
title: Giacomo Mori 1998 Castelrotto  (Chianti)

description: Bright cherry and cedary aromas open to a soft mouthfeel and tart blackberry flavors with black toast shadings. The dark flavors and light mouthfeel are a bit out of sync, as if the flavor range demands more weight on the palate. Tart black fruits show on the finish.
title: Abarbanel 1999 Estate Bottled Syrah (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Strays too far into the kitchen-herb spectrum for this taster. Big and creamy, with a mocha finish that lingers, but the fresh-cut thyme, parsley and basil make for an eccentric mouthful.
title: Palmer 1997 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Shows modest dark cherry fruit with cedar and leather accents. A lean, even mouthfeel and moderate acidity mark the palate. The tart dried-fruit flavors turn somewhat sour on the back end.
title: Vigna Piccola 1996  Chianti Classico

description: Looking brown around the edges, this wine is showing decline at an age when a good riserva should be hitting full stride. The fruit is stylishly sweet, but attenuated, and past its best in this pretty, older wine. Fading elegance, but why at just past five years of age?
title: Valiano 1995 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: Light, with some sour cherry fruit on the nose and palate that's outweighed throughout by a dry, woodiness that enters early and persists.
title: Coli 1998  Chianti Classico

description: Shows unexpected age, with brown around the edges and mature prune and orange-peel aromas. The flavors are more alive, but are not vibrant. Rather dull on the finish, this isn't bad wine but tastes like something four or five years older.
title: Castellare 1996 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: Bright red-berry aromas, decent weight and slightly tough tanins in the finish all point to this as a good partner to grilled burgers this summer.  100% Merlot.
title: Channing Perrine 1999 Mudd Vineyard Fleur de Terre Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Ripe melons and pears dance a delicate duet on the palate—softly and gently shifting ever so slightly from honeydew to Bosc and back, before turning lean and citrusy on the finish.
title: Palmer 1998 Estate Pinot Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

description: There's some light toast and vanilla flavors layered over modest Bosc-pear fruit, but a lack of intensity holds this wine back despite a generous mouthfeel and ample structure.
title: Macari 1998 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Sappy candied-cherry fruit aromas lead into a soft, easy-to-drink blend that's an unpretentious quaff for the backyard grill.
title: Pindar Vineyards NV Pythagoras Red (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Starts off with aromas of apple blossoms and ultraripe pears. The pear notes carry through on the palate, where they're joined by a touch of anise. This slightly sweet bottling pales in comparison to Paumanok's Dry Riesling, but offers a well-made, soft alternative.
title: Paumanok 2000 Semi Dry Riesling (North Fork of Long Island)

description: The cherry aromas and flavors here already have an aged quality. Some nice spicy accents conspire to keep it alive, but it closes rather tart and woody. Doesn't show the depth expected in a riserva.
title: Castellani 1997 Riserva  (Chianti)

description: A blended white, but predominantly-you guessed it-Chardonnay.  The soft, sweet pear aromas and flavors are simple and clean, making this a decent quaffer on a hot summer day.
title: Castello di Borghese NV Chardonette White (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Offers mild berry fruit allied to some green bell pepper and herb aromas.  A bit light and tart fo a single vineyrd wine, but still good.
title: Channing Daughters 1998 Sculpture Garden Merlot (Long Island)

description: Modest green-apple fruit is married to earthy grapefruit and lime flavors in this effort by Channing Daughters winemaker Larry Perrine.
title: Channing Perrine 1998 Oregon Road Riesling (Long Island)

description: There's some interesting game and slate accents on the nose here, but also a candied quality to the cherry fruit. The acidity is fairly high and the tannins tense and somewhat drying on the finish.
title: Badia di Morrona 1998 I Sodi del Paretaio  (Chianti)

description: Crushed mint, red berry and menthol aromas mix with an unusual scent suggesting paraffin. The aromas carry over to the straightforward linear palate together with sour cherry, thyme and clove alongside. Firm tannins and fresh acidity provide support.
title: Cantina del Nebbiolo 2013  Barolo

description: Rose petal, herb and camphor aromas are front and center. The full-bodied monolithic palate offers cranberry, morello cherry, star anise and the warmth of alcohol alongside solid tannins. It's big and rather straightforward for Barolo. Drink after 2023.
title: Cantina Terre del Barolo 2013  Barolo

description: A blend of 70% Pinot Nero and 30% Chardonnay, this has aromas of ripe orchard fruit, citrus and a whiff of pastry dough. The bright palate delivers golden apple and toasted almond alongside small persistent bubbles and fresh acidity.
title: Cascina Bretta Rossa 2009 Cuvée Leonora Sparkling (Alta Langa)

description: Golden-yellow in color, this bottling of a rarely planted grape from Italy's Campania region shows soft chamomile and sliced yellow apples on the pleasant nose. Squeezed lemon, light mandarin juice and a touch of walnut oil show on the sip, where the acid rises late and lasts long.
title: Castoro Cellars 2015 Oakenshield Vineyard Falanghina (Paso Robles)

description: Made with 100% native grape Erbaluce, this offers delicate aromas and flavors of ripe pear, green apple and citrus. A salty mineral note closes the crisp, clean finish.
title: Centovigne 2015 Miranda Erbaluce

description: While there are plenty of wood flavors here, the wine also has fine ripe blackberries. That gives potential balance and density. This fine wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château de Lionne 2015 L'Envolée de Lionne  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine has firm tannins and a dense texture that promises a good aging potential. Its ripe blackberry and black-plum fruits also show a solid wine with its richness and fine fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Rouquette 2016  Bordeaux

description: Produced in the hills above the small town of Castillon, the wine is fruity with a stalky texture and some firm tannins. It is balanced, though, with its acidity and black-currant flavors and should mature well over the next few years. Drink from 2018.
title: Château du Roc 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Rich and with good fruit, this is a structured wine that has the density to age well. The dark-chocolate flavors mingle with the black-plum fruits, finishing with just a light lift of acidity.
title: Château la Verrière 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a bold fruity wine that just allows its tannins to build a supporting structure. The black fruits are right up front, full of acidity and with a delicious potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Château le Grand Verdus 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: There is a caramel edge to this wine showing the wood-aging flavors. Luckily the fruit is all there as well, giving a balanced future to this structured wine. With plenty of tannins and juicy acidity combined, it will be a fine wine from 2019.
title: Château Saint Seurin 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Big tannins mask the fruit in this potentially ripe and fruity wine. It is structured and dark with a dry core of tannins. It means the wine needs time. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Vircoulon 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Showing fresh watermelon and canteloupe flavors, this light-bodied, dry wine is crisp in texture, with enough concentration to be mouth-filling. It's made frm 80% Barbera and 20% red Rhône varieties.
title: Day Owl 2016 Rosé (California)

description: Made from 40% Syrah, 30% Grenache, 20% Mourvèdre and 10% Carignan, this Roussillon rosé opens with elegant notes of green pepper and savory herbs that frame the tight red cherry and underripe melon fruits. Medium in weight and a touch plush in feel, red cherry and berry tones dominate the palate, but finish bright and with a slightly bitter, fruit skin-like edge on the close.
title: Domaine Cazes 2016 Les Clos De Paulilles Collioure Rosé (Collioure)

description: Clean aromas of black cherry, dried thyme and white pepper show that this bottling isn't just all about creative packaging, with its Grim Reaper theme. The flavors are also cohesive and well integrated, with nutmeg, clove and stewed red cherry working together.
title: Reaper 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Truffle, dried herb, espresso, new leather and balsamic aromas come together on this along with a whiff of wood shop. The firm tightly knit palate shows cranberry, sour cherry, clove and thyme framed in assertive close-grained tannins that leave a rather raspy finish. Drink after 2023.
title: San Biagio 2013 Capalot  (Barolo)

description: This attractive, smooth-textured wine offers plenty of almost-sweet fruit flavors like black cherry and prune dusted with cinnamon and cedar for complexity. The tannins are abundant but soft, so there is little astringency, and the wine is easy to sip and enjoy.
title: Shannon Ridge 2015 High Elevation Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)

description: The merest touch of passion fruit streaks the lemony, fresh nose. Although the palate seems a little dilute, it is light, fresh and finishes on a lingering lemon note.
title: Skoff 2016 Eichberger Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Obelisco, Olsen, Oasis and Kiona vineyards. Wood-forward aromas (60% new French oak) of char and coffee are out in front of herb and black cherry. The palate is on the lighter side of medium bodied, pulling up short on the finish. There's enjoyment to be had but the variety seems hard to find.
title: Sparkman 2014 Outlaw Merlot (Yakima Valley)

description: Dark in color and slightly reduced, this wine offers a waxy texture of apple, apricot and vanilla, medium in build with approachable richness and roundness. Smooth, it's a pleasant quaffer.
title: Spicy Vines 2015 Joie de Vivre Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: This wine all comes from Block 18 at this esteemed vineyard. The aromas bring a medley of herbs along with graphite, licorice and black cherry. The palate is medium bodied, but pulls up a bit short on the finish.
title: Tempus Cellars 2013 Dionysus Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This chunky, funky blend is led by the local Caiño Blanco grape, with Loureiro and Albariño in the mix. Lanolin is a more prominent aroma than any particular fruit, and this wine feels round but mature. Peach and dried melon flavors finish with little drive. Drink immediately.
title: Terras Gauda 2014 La Mar White (Rías Baixas)

description: Earthy aromas of truffle, forest floor, used leather and a funky whiff of barnyard carry over to the firm palate along with ripe black cherry, clove and a hint of game. It's on the rustic side but full of personality.
title: Viberti 2013 Buon Padre  (Barolo)

description: Carbonic freshness lurks on the palate of this appellation wine, dotted in strawberry jam, lavender and rose characteristics. Lightly textured and built, it finishes soft and smooth.
title: WesMar 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Fleshy, full bodied and concentrated, this holds rich flavors of wild vanilla, pear and peach. Needing time to unravel, it shows its oak and power without regret.
title: Jayson 2014 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The aromas are fresh, with notes of cranberry, red currant, baking spice and Red Vines. The palate is on the lighter side of medium bodied, trailing a bit on the finish. The vineyard, one of the state's top Syrah sites, doesn't seem to stand out as much as it typically does.
title: Kontos 2014 Les Collines Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Perfumed jasmine and orange blossom open this wine aromatically before a roundly rich palate of caramel oak and baked apple spiked in nutmeg evolve in the glass.
title: La Crema 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Crushed herb, violet, espresso, raspberry and menthol aromas carry over to the full-bodied but rounded palate along with cranberry and hints of anise and clove. Polished tannins provide support. Drink 2019–2025.
title: Le Cecche 2013 Sorano  (Barolo)

description: This starts off shy, but with time allows aromas of delicate peach, cherry and orange blossom to come through in the bouquet. Pleasant ripe-fruit flavors unfold on the clean, well-balanced palate, with lingering notes of peach pit and orange peel on the finish.
title: Les Vignerons de Florensac 2016 Rosé été Rosé (Côtes de Thau)

description: Dense aromas of cooked blueberries meet with clove, ginger and leather on the nose of this red blend. Leathery flavors also show on the palate along with black currant and more baking-spice touches.
title: Lorenzi Estate 2013 Brutus II Red (Temecula Valley)
