A celebrated star of the Veneto, this oak-aged red offers enormous density and intensity, with soft, velvety layers and bright aromas of red fruit, spice and dried sage. The finish is characterized by savory, herbal notes that are fresh and tantalizing.
title: Maculan 2009 Fratta Red (Veneto)

description: This is pure Cabernet that was sourced from four vineyards, with vines averaging 31 years. True noninterventionist winemaking is in play to make this chewy, tight and dark effort.This is grainy and dense, with notes of cassis, coffee and cacao. A thread of smoke and a touch of gravel contribute further to the concentrated finish.
title: Efeste 2009 Big Papa Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Marvelous details of tea, honeysuckle and lemon mark the entry of this exceptional Riesling. It's vivid and textural, with terrific acidity, backbone and length—cellar worthy for sure.
title: Efeste 2011 Evergreen Vineyard Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is grandiose, with ripe apricot and peach flavors—even a note of mango—that are allied to the wood notes. As a contrast, there is fine acidity and elegance, with a lemon zest edge that gives structure to this full, superripe, powerful effort.
title: Henri de Villamont 2009  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Using grapes sourced from 50-year-old vines, this is a powerful expression of rich Chardonnay. It has great depth of flavor, with concentrated, intense and ripe yellow and white fruits, spiced from having aged in the wood. Allow to age for over five years.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2009 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Dark and bloody, this masterfully mixes layer upon layer of detail. Red meat, black olive, cassis and earth roll across the tongue, while hints of flower and chocolate linger in the nose. Complex, tart and earthy, this is as good as it gets in this price range.
title: Southard 2009 Lawrence Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Rich, blood warming and heady, this has vast and complex flavors of blackberry jam, licorice, bacon, spice and sweet, smoky sandalwood. It's hard to imagine a better wine to drink with barbecue.
title: Summers 2009 Four-Acre Zinfandel (Calistoga)

description: Terre Rouge's loftiest undertaking every vintage, this Ascent is a blockbuster. It's gorgeously spicy and floral, with dark notes of pepper, violet and herb that will live long and prosper in time. Grapes used for this bottling are sourced from cool, high-elevation vineyards, providing the wine perfect balance between big, bold fruit and provocative acidity.
title: Terre Rouge 2009 Ascent Syrah (Sierra Foothills)

description: Full, gorgeous and bright, this shows restraint and elegance, with lovely aromas of sweet cherry, blackberry pie, leather, tar and black licorice. In keeping with Valpolicella tradition, there is a touch of sweetness on the palate, but the quality of the fruit is clean and polished. Hold for 10 years or more.
title: Zenato 2007  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: This is dark and wood laden, with sweet, rich fruit and a firm, dense structure. It has a full feel, and its opulence is likely to develop over the next 2–3 years.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2009 Clos des Fèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This is crisp, with citrus and red apple fruits that are heightened by the taut structure. Nervy acidity adds to the tense feel while judicious layers of wood warm the finish. For long-term aging.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2010 Les Chenevottes Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Romano Dal Forno applies the same stringent quality standards on his so-called base wine as he does his top-tier Amarone. But referring to this Valpolicella Superiore as a “base wine” couldn't be more incorrect. In fact, this singular expression occupies its very own category in which the utmost attention is paid to the smallest details. It opens with dark, inky concentration and amazing intensity, with black cherry, barbecue spice, leather and tobacco.
title: Dal Forno Romano 2007  Valpolicella Superiore

description: Structured, dense and packed with black fruits, this is complex wine. Yet with all of its ripeness, it offers a great line of freshness and a smoky wood flavor, with blackberry-like acidity on the finish. Age for five years or more.
title: Domaine Drouhin-Laroze 2010 Lavaut Saint-Jacques Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: A wonderfully balanced wine, this shows a vanilla note that harmonizes with its ripe tropical fruit and a distinct touch of minerality. Wood aging shows through on the finish.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2010 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Claret is the old-fashioned word for Bordeaux, but it has no legal meaning in the U.S. This Cabernet-based wine contains some Syrah, which gives a smoked meat or bacon note to the blackberries and black currants. It's delicious, if a little sweet.
title: Bell 2006 Claret Red (Napa Valley)

description: Broad and ripe, this is textured with some citric character, its acidity cutting through the green plum flavors. The aftertaste is freshly mouth watering.
title: Cave de Lugny 2008 Les Beluses  (Mâcon-Chardonnay)

description: A wine with just the right Meursault opulence already the dominant character. The wine is fat, ripe, not losing sight of acidity or freshness, combining yellow fruits with a crisp, citrus final streak.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2007  Meursault

description: Here is a nicely executed Pinot Grigio with a slightly bigger, more succulent style than your standard Pinot Grigio. Mature fruit aromas of peach, honey and melon make for a nice balance against the wine's natural freshness.
title: Conti Formentini 2009 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This is a strongly flavored Cabernet. It has upfront blackberry and red cherry jam flavors, with some sweet spicy notes from French oak barrels. It's not a wine you want to age, but is smooth and flattering now.
title: Decoy 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Fruit fans will exult in this jammy Pinot Noir. It floods the mouth with raspberries, cherries and cola, with an elaborate coating of sweet, smoky sandalwood. The richness is balanced with fine acidity. Best now and over the next year or so.
title: Ketcham Estate 2008 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is soft, full of ripe white fruit flavors. The wine is broad, showing some freshness along with the forward richness. It is likely to age relatively quickly.
title: Louis Latour 2008  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: Pinot Grigio and Verduzzo are blended to shape a fresh and luminous white wine that would pair with seafood or light chicken dishes. The wine is clean and sharp on the palate with zesty acidity on the close.
title: Masi 2009 Masianco White (Delle Venezie)

description: The question is how much oak can you handle? If you like a heavily toasted, resiny type of full-bodied Chardonnay, add two or three points. If you absolutely hate that style, then subtract a few points. For those of us in between, look for resiny, toasty, heavy aromas on top of a thick, chewy palate full of baked apple and tons of wood spice. One-dimensional but well made.
title: Monteviejo 2008 Lindaflor Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Bright aromas of Granny Smith apple, green fruit, melon and honey emerge from the nose of this fragrant expression of Pinot Grigio. It is creamy and textured in the mouth with a touch of smooth almond paste on the close.
title: Niedermayr Josef 2009 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: A good red wine that does just what Merlot is supposed to do, be enjoyable now. It's softly fruity and immediately likeable, with pleasant cherry pie, blackberry, cocoa and sandalwood flavors.
title: Peter Franus 2007 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: This medium-bodied Barossa blend displays supple tannins and a silky finish, making it immediately accessible. Hints of smoke and sweat and complexity to the currant aromas and flavors.
title: Peter Lehmann 2007 Clancy's - Shiraz - Cabernet Sauvignon - Merlot Red (Barossa)

description: A drying mineral tone slices through the center of this luminous Pinot Grigio and adds a pretty edge to aromas of peach, citrus and pear. It also wins points in the mouth thanks to its tonic, fresh fruit flavors.
title: Plozner 2009 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: This new baby from Crasto is an easygoing wine, full of berry fruits, gentle tannins. It is ready to drink, finishing softly and freshly.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2008 Flor de Crasto Red (Douro)

description: The apricot and pear flavors are obviously very ripe, but they're balanced by brisk acidity, and a certain stong minerality you often find in Carneros Chardonnays. Oak plays its part. A bit obvious, but for the price, there's plenty of opulence.
title: RouteStock 2009 Route 121 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Snoqualmie can legitimately lay claim to being Washington's most consistent and reliable producer of mass market, value-priced wines. This tart and racy Syrah is a fine example of the quality—no frills, but no fudging either. It tastes like fruit—blueberries and boysenberries, with some leafy, herbal tannins. In perfect balance, it's a fine every day wine with more flavor interest than most ten buck merlots and cabs.
title: Snoqualmie 2007 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Tolloy brings us a bright and luminous Pinot Grigio with a very attractive price tag. You'll recognize aromas of citrus, peach, passion fruit and kiwi and the wine would pair with tuna or curry chicken salad.
title: Tolloy 2009 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: This fun “ramato” or copper-colored Pinot Grigio (the color is a result of longer contact with the skins of the grape during winemaking) offers aromas of pink grapefruit, stone fruit and mineral.
title: Attems 2009 Cupra Ramato Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: This Primitivo opens with inviting peppery aromas, followed by bright fruit and spice overtones, along with a nice bead of acidity throughout. A good pizza and lasagna wine.
title: Brutocao 2010 Contento Vineyard Primitivo (Mendocino)

description: This Chianti Classico riserva offers black fruit aromas accented with spice, coffee and oak. The palate delivers black cherry, oak, vanilla and black pepper along with bracing tannins. It's a bit shy on fresh acidity and finishes on a drying, tannic note.
title: Castelli del Grevepesa 2009 Clemente VII Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: An obviously wood aged wine, with burnt toast and spice dominant at this young stage. Happily, there is enough black currant fruit and fruity acidity underneath to support this overdose of wood. Give it time to fully integrate, and drink from 2016.
title: Château Bois Cardon 2011  Médoc

description: A rich and rounded wine whose tannins are well buried in the ripe blackberry fruits. It's a dark wine, solidly dry at the core with great swathes of juicy fruit around. It's almost ready to drink so try it out in 2014.
title: Château de Paillet-Quancard 2010  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A dry style of wine that only slowly reveals its juicy character to bring out a warmer, richer side. It also does show considerable toast and spiciness along with firm tannins all of which still need to fully integrate. So don't drink until 2016.
title: Château d'Uza 2010  Graves

description: A huge wine, as indicated by the alcohol, this is dark, dense and extracted. It has bitter chocolate and sweet licorice flavors, strong signs of the wood aging, along with juicy blackberry fruit. Powerful and concentrated, it needs to age. Drink from 2016.
title: Vinha Paz 2011 Colheita Red (Dão)

description: Coming from a single block of the winery's estate vineyard, it has notes of cranberry, black pepper, herbs and moist earth speckled with oak spices (30% new French). The palate has soft, sleek cherry flavors buffeted by firm tannins.
title: Abacela 2009 Reserve South Face Block Syrah (Umpqua Valley)

description: Light and lively, this is a bright, tangy, fruit-driven effort, with little or no evident barrel flavor. Apples and white peaches hold down the center, with a crisp, fresh finish.
title: Adelsheim 2012 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a second wine from Amici Cellars. It's rich and forward with cherry, blackberry, licorice and mocha flavors that taste fruity-sweet, but finish dry. Elegantly constructed, it's a polished wine to drink now.
title: Amici 2010 Olema Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

description: This is a brilliant wine that showcases Edna Valley's ability to produce some of the purest white-wine flavors in California. If there's any oak, it's not apparent at all. What you get are crisp, clean flavors of citrus and tropical fruits, peaches, vanilla, white pepper and herbs.
title: Baker & Brain 2012 Paragon Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Edna Valley)

description: This is a very good Napa Cabernet, stylishly dry and smooth in tannins. It's rich in blackberries, cherries and sweet new oak, with earthier hints of dried sage and tobacco. Drink now–2016.
title: Bell 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This structured Barbera offers aromas of ripe cherry, raspberry and plum with light toasted notes. The palate delivers a tight core of black cherry with black pepper and licorice, layered with a hint of espresso. This still needs a year or two to fully unwind, so it's best after 2015.
title: Caldera 2011  Barbera d'Asti

description: Here's a smooth and juicy wine that has great black fruit aromas and flavors. It has good balance between the dry tannins and firm structure of Dão and the fruity character, meaning it is likely to develop over the medium term. Drink from 2015.
designation: Casa da Passarella A Descoberta Colheita
title: Casa da Passarella 2010 Casa da Passarella A Descoberta Colheita Red (Dão)

description: With great fragrance and just a touch of spiciness, this is full-bodied ripe wine. Along with the more exotic flavors, it has intense apple and nectarine fruit, and a bright, tight texture. Drink now, or age for a year.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Somontes Colheita Branco White (Dão)

description: A perfumed wine that is ripe and richly tannic, with the minerality of the Douro. It has weight, while also retaining elegance and rounded black fruits. Give this wine a few years, and drink from 2015.
title: Casca Wines 2009 Cape Roca Boat Red (Douro)

description: Castello d'Albola's Chianti Classico has a typical fragrance of ripe berry accented with hints of violet and spice. The bright palate delivers ripe, red cherry and white pepper along with round tannins. Pair it with pasta topped with ragù or barbecued steaks.
title: Castello d'Albola 2009  Chianti Classico

description: A fresh, fruity and sophisticated wine, this offers acidity balanced by dry tannins. It has juicy black currant fruits, hints of mint and a bright, smoky feel. The wine will obviously age, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Arnaud 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: A well-balanced wine that both shows an herbaceous character and a ripe, full flavor that brings in yellow fruits and green plums. It has a well-judged hint of spice from wood aging to give extra richness. Drink from 2013.
title: Château Magnol 2012 Les Charmes de Magnol  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: The Stoller-sourced Pinot is forward and ripe, with pretty fruit flavors in a compact, light vintage. Cola, peach, black cherry and milk chocolate components swirl together, fading gently into a light finish. Drink over the next 2–3 years.
title: Chehalem 2011 Stoller Vineyards Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: A touch of French oak brings a honeyed, vanilla smokiness to this wine, but the star really is the fruit. It's rich and forward with pineapples, peaches and mangoes, and made brilliant by crisp acidity. This is a good price for a Chardonnnay of this quality.
title: Curtis 2012 Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: A heavily wood-aged wine, this wine has smoky, burnt-toast aromas. At the moment, ripe yellow-fruit flavors are submerged beneath this onslaught of wood, but it should integrate better, so give it until 2016.
title: Domaine Jean Monnier et Fils 2011 Mersault-Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: A blend of Chardonnay and Touriga Nacional, this is a ripe, mature wine that shows a great balance between acidity and rich flavors of almond and toast. It has weight but still hints at freshness. This is a food sparkling wine.
title: Falua 2009 Conde de Vimioso Extra Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)

description: This brut offers notes of citrus, stone fruit and Mediterranean herbs. It's fresh and linear, with an elegant perlage. The quenching finish closes on a note of bitter walnut.
title: Fratelli Berlucchi 2009 Brut Vintage Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: Leathery, mossy aromas of dark-berry fruits lead to a bright, energetic, acid-driven palate with quality flavors of plum and spiced blackberry. This has zest and savory notes on the finish, and overall it's fresh in feel, tasty and not too demanding.
title: Indomita 2011 Duette Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: A brilliantly strawberry-flavored rosé, this is crisp and fresh with lively acidity. There's a tight citrus texture, but the main thrust of this delicious summer rosé is fruitiness.
title: Jean-Noël Haton NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: With some good bottle age, this is a soft, biscuit- and almond-flavored wine. There is a crisp edge from the grapefruit flavor underneath, making this a Champagne that's full of character and ready to drink now.
title: Jean-Noël Haton NV Classic Brut  (Champagne)

description: Fruity strawberry flavor leads this ripe and soft wine. The palate has a crisp edge to it, with touches of orange zest. The aftertaste, light and delicate, is laced with minerality.
title: Jean-Noël Haton NV Extra Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Steely mineral notes accent luscious white grapefruit and yellow nectarine flavors on the nose of this delicate, yet lushly textured spätlese. It's softly sweet, with hints of honey and peach nectar, but bristling with acidity. A surprising bargain buy from Karl Josef.
title: Karl Josef 2011 Piesporter Michelsberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Good price for a nice wine that shows some real Pinot character. The mouthfeel is light and silky, and fine acidity gives a bit to the red stone fruits and berries.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2012 Coastal Estates Pinot Noir (California)

description: Earthy berry and cola aromas are clean and ripe. This feels fresh on the tongue, with medium-level weight and power. Flavors run toward cassis and berry but fade quickly, with little to the finish. This is Garnacha with 25% Tempranillo.
title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2009 Castillo de Fuendejalon Crianza Red (Campo de Borja)

description: A ripe and fruity wine, the lemon flavors are complemented by rich melon and orange zest. It's a wine that has a dense texture, with the acidity well integrated into the fruitiness.
title: Bougrier 2012 Château du Jaunay Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)

description: Here's a nice Cabernet with some extra features of elegance. It's not for the cellar, but shows polished blackberry, currant and mocha flavors, wrapped into pretty strong, dry tannins. Give it an hour in the decanter and drink now.
title: Cameron Hughes 2011 Lot 385 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: There's a raisin skin bitterness and some raisiny, Port-like flavors to this Cabernet Franc, suggesting some of the grapes were roasted on the vine. Other than that, it's softly tannic and savory, with cherry pie and oak notes.
title: Turnbull 2010 Leopoldina Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Oakville)

description: This Trebbiano is fermented in concrete tanks with no selected yeasts. The nose isn't very expressive but the palate shows restrained notes of golden apple, lemon drop and flint. This is already evolved and starting to fade so enjoy soon.
title: Cantina Tollo 2010 C'Incanta  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

description: Here's a delightful and frothy dessert wine made from the aromatic Malvasia di Candia grape that expresses sweet peach, grapefruit, ginger and sage flavors. It has a silky texture and a refreshing finish. Pair this with pastries or Sunday brunch.
title: Castello di Luzzano 2012 Malvasia Frizzante Sfacciata Malvasia di Candia (Colli Piacentini)

description: Castle Rock is one of the most reliable sources of inexpensive Columbia Valley red wines. Ignore the generic label—what's inside the bottle is well-made. Light flavors of black cherry, soft tannins and a finishing flourish of mocha and red apple give this both lift and length.
title: Castle Rock 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The oak is heavy-handed, giving the wine strong buttered toast and caramelized flavors despite rich pineapple and lemon fruit. The winery's Stainless Unoaked 2011 Chardonnay bottling is more balanced.
title: Chamisal Vineyards 2011 Estate Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This is pure Viognier, finishing in a moderately sweet, dessert-friendly style. There is a candied sensation to the mouthfeel, and the fruit seems rather thin. Light flavors of orange pekoe carry into a gentle finish.
title: Columbia Crest 2012 Reserve Late Harvest Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This lemon- and pear-flavored wine has an attractive, fresh fruitiness, tight acidity and a very crisp feeling. It is light and bright.
designation: Domaine de la Tourmaline Sur Lie
title: Gadais Père et Fils 2012 Domaine de la Tourmaline Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)

description: Scents and flavors of toasted grain introduce this pretty wine that boasts accents of citrus blossom. Hints of peach skin carry some bite in the back of the mouth. Serve chilled and drink soon.
title: Garofalo 2012 Les Collines Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: A scent of juicy black plum commingles with notes of milk chocolate, game and sun-baked straw. Medium to full bodied, this wine is structured with lively acidity and leathery tannins. A bitterness that's akin to grapefruit pith adds tension to the finish.
title: Doukénie 2010 Petit Verdot (Virginia)

description: Hints of wet granite and tobacco lend a savory note to tart cranberry and cherry flavors in this earthy offering. Full bodied in style with layers of soft, fine-grained tannins, it has a bold earthy and leathery finish.
title: Palmer 2009 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This deep-colored Malbec hits hard with cola and blackberry aromas. It's a muscular, oaky specimen on the palate, with noticeable tannins. Flavors of wood and toast are in the lead, followed by black fruits, clove and lemon rind. Drink now through 2016.
title: Finca Las Moras 2011 Black Label Malbec (San Juan)

description: This pale pink rosé is 100% Cinsault--an oddity in the Rhône, where so many wines are blended. It's only moderately weighty and rather crisp, with tart, citrusy notes and hints of underripe stone fruit, giving it a straightforward, linear appeal.
title: Laurence Féraud 2012 Pink Pégau Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Aromas of briny red fruits, dried cheese and brick dust set up a grabby, raw feeling palate with flavors of roasted berry fruits, cassis, rubber and earth. A standard finish with a touch of heat confirms that this is solid everyday stuff.
title: Marqués de Riscal 2010 Próximo  (Rioja)

description: This straightforward wine isn't particularly Cabernet-like, but it is good and sound. With furry tannins, it has a distinct sweetness of raisins and blackberry jam, as well as lots of brambly Zinny spices. Drink up.
title: Merriam 2009 Windacre Vineyard Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Russian River Valley)

description: From Sardinia, this is a delightful rosé made with native grapes. It offers strawberry, crushed cherry and myrtle berry aromas that carry over to the palate along with a slightly sweet finish.
title: Argiolas 2012 Serra Lori Red (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: Sourced from a host of vineyards, many of them in Sonoma County, this is an intensely dark, weighty Chardonnay with a taste of sour lemon and apple, rich in oak with a clean finish.
title: B.R. Cohn 2011 Silver Label Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: The combination of mouthwatering acidity, steely flavors of citrus fruits, apricots, white flowers and honey, and finesse make this slightly oaked Albariño super drinkable. With a trace of honey, it will be perfect with Vietnamese fare, smoky ham dishes, or fried chicken with potato salad.
title: Bodegas M 2011 Querida Albariño (Edna Valley)

description: This Bordeaux-style blend is bone dry and scented strongly with dried leaves, earth and herbs. The lightly-ripened fruit suggests pomegranate and rhubarb.
title: Cairdeas 2011 Consonance Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A distinctive, fruit forward wine with notes of blueberry and ash. It's fresh with tannins adding gruffness.
title: Cascade Ridge 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Golden apple, butterscotch and white peach notes dominate this Chardonnay's nose. The bright acidity gives the creamy palate some lift, and the finish entices with its focused hazelnut flavor.
title: 868 Estate NV Chardonnay (Virginia)

description: Smoky berry aromas come with notes of rubber band and earth. A chunky, full-bodied, rubbery-feeling palate comes next, followed by herbal flavors of blackberry and blueberry. Prune, blueberry and hard spice flavors finish in Bordeaux style.
title: Bodega NQN 2011 Picada 15 Malbec (Patagonia)

description: Dry, spicy, leathery aromas are herbal but solid. This feels full and balanced but rudimentary, with cherry, cassis, chocolate and herbal flavors. A finish of dark-fruit flavors comes with overt oak notes, peppery spice and heat.
title: Bodega Volcanes de Chile 2011 Summit 2900 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

description: Graphite and vanilla aromas are offset by herbal, stemmy notes of hard spice and mint. The palate shows tomatoey acidity and flavors of pie cherry, tart plum, cherry tomato and vanilla. As might be expected given the precedings, the finish is cleansing and high in acid.
title: Viña Bujanda 2010 Crianza  (Rioja)

description: There's quite a bit of oak on this wine, in the way of smoky, ashy toast and dill notes. Lees aging adds richer winemaker complications of cream and sourdough. With lemon, lime, nectarine and peach flavors, it's dryishly sweet, soft and easy to drink now.
title: Clendenen 2012 Mesa Verde Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Lots of rich, extracted cherry pie, chocolate and cassis flavors in this soft, oaky Cabernet. It's a little sweet and hot, but will drink well now with grilled steak.
title: Collier Falls 2010 Hillside Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Good Pinot Noir for the price. It's a little soda-poppy, with raspberry and cherry pie flavors, but the acidity is brisk, and the mouthfeel is nice and silky.
title: Don & Sons 2011 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: While this Grüner does not give away too much on its rather closed nose, the savory hints of pepper, arugula, pear and thyme unite beautifully and insistingly on the midpalate. The wine gets full marks for refreshing, authentic typicity.
title: Wieninger 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)

description: The mighty partnership between the Hyde and de Villaine families shows maturity in this vineyard-designated wine, from the Hyde's well-respected site. Ripe golden pear delivers a richness to the palate that is offset by floral minerality and a pleasant texture of citrus and spice.
title: HdV 2011 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Made with 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this opens with aromas of forest floor, blue flower, black fruit, graphite and a balsamic note. The juicy palate delivers crushed black cherry, white pepper, clove and licorice alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2018.
title: Canonica a Cerreto 2010  Chianti Classico

description: Tingling lemon and grapefruit pith make for a tantalizing experience in this white made from several vineyard sources throughout the Napa Valley. Saline and wet stone provide the minerality, with a searing seasoning of lemongrass. The wine finishes on a tart, herbal note that yearns to be matched with seafood.
title: Atalon 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: While intensely floral from nose to finish, this subtly nuanced Riesling has a more savory side as well, offsetting stark lemon, tangerine and lime flavors against wet stone and clay. It's ethereal and light on the palate, but finishes boldly with a lingering murmur of astringency.
designation: Tanzen Dame Auten Vineyard 2nd Clone 239 Dry
title: Bloomer Creek 2013 Tanzen Dame Auten Vineyard 2nd Clone 239 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: While demure on the nose, this dry, seemingly diminutive Riesling builds in power and concentration on the palate. It's fairly low in alcohol, with an unassuming gradation of flavors ranging from lime to lemon and grapefruit, but its rippling textural expanse lends persistence and gravitas.
title: Boundary Breaks 2013 No. 239 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: This wine intoxicates aromatically in wild cherry and strawberry before entering into an entirely different direction of feral earth. Softly smooth on the palate, it's enjoyable now and an interesting taste experience, with an unfussy finish.
title: Bruliam 2013 Torrey Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: There's a subdued struck-match aromas on this wine by Billy Wathen and Dick Dore, with apple soda, seared pear and chalky minerality also apparent. There is powerful zing on the palate, like apple slices splashed with lemon juice, altogether clean, crisp and lively, with chalky grip arising on the finish.
title: Foxen 7200 2013 7200 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: Earthy aromas of truffle, leather, tar, crushed plum and a hint of mocha lead the nose. The vibrant palate delivers black cherry, raspberry, graphite, tobacco and a licorice note alongside firm, polished tannins. Enjoy through 2018.
title: Gabriele Valeriani 2010 Morone  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Aromas of forest floor, spiced plum, blue flower and a whiff of leather entice in the glass. The savory palate offers juicy wild cherry, nectarine zest, cinnamon and grilled herb alongside firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2017.
title: Gabriele Valeriani 2011 Morone  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: There's a lightness of being to this wine that makes it ethereal. Light in texture and body, layers of earthy strawberry and red cherry remain crisp and fresh on the palate, with a faint aroma of rose petal marking the bouquet.
title: Gehricke 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Barrel aromas of vanilla, coconut and cocoa take the lead on this blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Mourvèdre, Cabernet Franc and Malbec, followed by dried cherry and plum. The cranberry and sour-cherry flavors are concentrated and disclose an intriguing mixture of tart and sweet.
title: Goose Ridge 2012 g3 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Nutty flavors of new oak signal a more international style of Pinot, but the underlying fruit speaks eloquently of ripe, red cherry and offers glimpses of raspberry. Subtle spice plays around the edges. The palate is rounded and soft but has a refreshing vein of acidity.
title: Hillinger 2013 Eveline Pinot Noir (Burgenland)

description: Lighter in color, this blend of Conner Lee, Red Mountain Vineyard and Elephant Mountain fruit has aromas of freshly brewed coffee, dark chocolate, toasty barrel spices and red fruit, with the barrel notes taking the lead. It's silky-soft in feel, with generous raspberry flavors that show a pleasing sense of balance, all backed by a light squeeze of tannins.
title: J. Bookwalter 2012 Foreshadow Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Another of the producer's estate-grown offerings, this vineyard-designate is bittersweet on the palate, rich and yet softly smooth in anise and waxy apple. Plenty of acidity buoys the experience, adding to the wine's ability to stay crisply refreshing on the finish.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2013 Bow Tie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: All the characteristic pepperiness of Zweigelt swings enticingly on nose and palate of this fresh-faced wine. This is medium bodied, fruit-driven and made incredibly appetizing by white pepper notes that pervade and complement the cherry fruit. Vibrant fruit singles this out.
title: Johanneshof Reinisch 2013 Zweigelt (Thermenregion)

description: Combined with 20% Grenache, this full-bodied, fruit-forward wine brings sweet aromas and flavors of raspberry jam and plum. Aged in mostly neutral oak, it possesses purity that carries through the finish.
title: L'Ecole No. 41 2012 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Intensely earthy, this wine hails predominantly from Susanna's Vineyard, a site in the heart of the Green Valley section of the larger Russian River Valley that's known for its elevation and coolness. Here, crisp raspberry and cherry do provide a sense of that coolness, but the wine develops into a substantial behemoth of full-bodied richness and weight, with a powerful, peppery finish.
title: MacPhail 2012 The Flyer Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Sourced from six different vineyards, this is a broadly pleasing wine, fruity in blackberry and raspberry that veers even into cranberry and cassis territory without getting bogged down. Substantial and lush, it's tightly woven in tannin and savory herb, ready to open itself over time. Patience will reward with more exotic interweavings of vanilla-cola and tea.
title: Merry Edwards 2012 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The producer continues to impress with this variety, an increasingly popular wine for her loyal followers and beyond. Rich in crème brûlée and vanilla, it's layered and well-textured, a mix of pear and orange blossom with a tropical edge that finishes with a nice lift of minerality.
title: Merry Edwards 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a big, bold, but welcoming wine with tons of flavor, plenty of tannin but an almost silky texture that invites another sip. The deep red-black color goes almost to the rim. Aromas are like apple skin and red cherries and the flavor suggests blackberries. Its richness without heaviness helps it stand out from the pack.
title: Naggiar 2011 Estate Malbec (Sierra Foothills)

description: Faint notes of peony and oak play above the red plum fruit, leading to a wonderfully peppery, oak-scented but nonetheless very refreshing red. This is an ambitious rendition of slender, fruity Zweigelt in oak that does justice to the peppery, fresh nature of this variety.
title: Netzl 2013 Rubin Zweigelt (Carnuntum)

description: Zweigelt can do easy-drinking styles but in the right hands, it can also turn into something more elegant. That's the case here: This exudes sophistication. Subtle use of oak supports the supple structure and gives the ripe red cherry fruit a more velvety spin. While this is ready now, it may well get even better with a year or two in bottle.
title: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2013 Heideboden Zweigelt (Burgenland)

description: This wine shows roasted beef with blackberry crust, fresh-cracked black pepper and tarry asphalt on the nose. The asphalt and charred meat play strongly on the heavy-duty palate that also offers blackberry balsamic reduction. It's brawny and burly, perhaps too much so for the everyday drinker.
title: No Limit 2010 All-In Sawyer Lindquist Vineyard Syrah (Edna Valley)

description: Has this property been making strides, or is it just the superb quality of the 2013 vintage? Either way, this is a wine worth trying. The cherry and spice flavors are spot on, as is the medium body, silky mouthfeel and long, crisp finish. Drink now–2020.
title: Paddy Borthwick 2013 Paper Road Pinot Noir (Wairarapa)

description: This is textbook Central Otago Pinot, from the nuances of wild thyme to the bold cherry fruit and mouthwatering finish. This medium-bodied wine is structured enough to last several years, but soft enough to drink now.
title: Peregrine 2012 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this blend of Sangiovese and 10% Merlot highights earthy aromas of underbrush, moist earth and dark berry. The lively palate offers ripe black cherry, nectarine zest and a hint of ground pepper while ripe tannins provide the framework. Enjoy through 2016.
title: La Selva 2013  Morellino di Scansano

description: Aromas of underbrush, leather, tar and game lead the nose. The earthy aromas carry over to the palate along with mature plum, juicy black cherry, truffle, tobacco and graphite. Smooth tannins soften up the wine's rustic, forward nature.
title: Le Casalte 2010  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Hailing from 11 different vineyards located across the Columbia Valley, this appealing, 100% varietal wine provides aromas of toasty spices, dried herbs, cocoa and jammy dark fruit. The cranberry, coffee and blackberry flavors are sweet and focused, backed by chewy, lightly dry tannins that need time to soften.
title: L'Ecole No. 41 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Beautifully aromatic notes of Williams pear on the nose give way to a far more streamlined palate of zesty grapefruit. This is slender, zippy and totally refreshing with its lemony brightness.
title: Loimer 2014 Lenz Riesling (Niederösterreich)

description: A big-boned wine with a juicy midpalate, this round, plush expression of the variety offers welcome layers of dark cherry, raspberry and plum nicely accentuated with clove and sage.
title: AuburnJames 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Light in color, this wine brings aromas of peppermint, herb, sarsaparilla and spice. The flavors are light and transparent, showing a very pretty sense of styling.
title: Marion-Field 2014 The Harrison Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Full bodied and well balanced, this wine has a broad, mouthfilling texture and enough concentration to carry its rich fruit notes into the finish. Cedar and black currant aromas meet black cherry and blackberry flavors, while a layer of fine-grained tannins frames the whole picture.
title: Moniker 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)

description: 2015's ripe red cherry fruit is presented here in a compact, taut, and concentrated package of freshness and verve. It has lovely pepper spice and ample freshness, giving focus to its lovely, crunchy, fresh cherry fruit.
title: Nittnaus Anita und Hans 2015 Zweigelt (Burgenland)

description: Yeasty bready aromas are more smooth and leesy than fruity. This has a round palate that's full but not creamy due to firm acidity. Melon, peach and vanilla flavors finish yeasty and dry, with moderate complexity. This is made entirely from Pinot Noir.
title: Parxet 2012 Titiana Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

description: Creamy butter and vanilla aromas suggest richness in this vineyard-designated wine, and its body and texture are equally full. Spicy oak and nutmeg flavors accent its dense, ripe apple and pear flavors, adorned in caramelized honey.
title: Peter Paul Wines 2014 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A generous ripe wine that has tannins that have been tamed by the dominance of the black fruitiness. The wine is smooth, ready to drink with its soft generous texture. Great fruit and rich tannins are well integrated. The wine finishes with a lift of acidity.
title: Producteurs Plaimont 2012 Cuvée 1907 Tannat-Cabernet (Madiran)

description: A lovely, yeasty savor clings to more characteristic pear notes on the nose of this wine. The palate repeats this interplay, with flashes of watercress-like green herb and fresh pear skin flavors. It's refreshing, savory and dry, with a light and spritzy body.
title: R&A; Pfaffl 2016 Vom Haus Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: Father-and-son vintners Joe and Sam Miller consistently deliver solid wines, including this twist-top Merlot that's aged in 50% new French oak. Its boysenberry fruit is awash in the green peppercorn, herb and crushed graphite character associated with the mountainous region. That pyrazine touch hits the palate, along with black pepper and dark chocolate spice, accenting the tangy red fruit.
title: Rexford 2013 Regan Vineyards Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This bulky bullish Malbec opens with big tarry aromas that go heavy on the oak. The palate is tannic like the clack-clack of heels on a tile floor. This tastes earthy, oaky and like blackberry, while the finish echoes with those same flavors. Drink through 2023.
title: Ruca Malen 2012 Kinien Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Dry spicy aromas accent woodsy berry scents. A tight focused palate jabs with acidity and poking tannins, while this tastes of lightly herbal cherry and berry fruit. Spicy flavors on a healthy finish help this along.
title: Ruca Malen 2013 Reserva Petit Verdot (Mendoza)

description: Structured and alluring, this opens with yellow stone fruit, tomato vine and chopped herb aromas. The enveloping palate doles out juicy yellow peach, grapefruit and savory thyme notes while tangy acidity lends balance.
title: Russiz Superiore 2012 Riserva Sauvignon (Collio)

description: As gamy as foie gras, and just as rich, this 100% varietal wine fills the palate with baked plum, licorice and intense ripe fruit that borders on confected. Soft tannins and supportive oak give it structure and breadth.
title: Sbragia 2013 Teldeschi Vineyard Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Oregon is loaded with inexpensive Pinot Noirs these days, but very few are estate grown and carry the Willamette Valley AVA. Pretty and aromatic with engaging scents of cherries and cream, this has immediate appeal. Drink with pork, poultry, salmon and salads—this is your go-to, anytime bottle.
title: Scenic Valley Farms 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Loads of fruit show on the nose of this wine: green and red apple, strawberry and ample, zesty citrus. The palate is taut, fresh, dry and precise, shot through with appetizing fruity flavors. A wonderful, flavorsome rosé, with or without food.
title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2016 Cistercien Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: This full-bodied and robustly concentrated wine has chocolate and cherry aromas, rich and ripe plum and blackberry flavors and layers of chocolate and vanilla on the palate and finish. It feels broad and juicy in texture, too.
title: Skinner 2014 Six Horse Zinfandel (El Dorado)

description: Pale salmon in color, but quite robust in flavor and alcohol, this brings concentrated flavors of watermelon and raspberries, with all the freshness of the newest vintage. It's bright and focused, the very picture of what is most exciting about these seasonal Northwest rosés.
title: Spindrift Cellars 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: There's a distinct herbal hint to the green pear notes on the nose of this wine. The light palate leads with white pepper, pear and lemon flavors, and the finish is clean and dry.
title: Stadlmann 2016 Badener Berg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: Fresh citrus and pear notes govern the nose and palate of this light-bodied, zippy and refreshing wine. It's peppery and zesty at its core, with a lip-smacking and very invigorating finish.
title: Stift Göttweig 2016 Messwein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: Admirably concentrated and complex, this is a medium- to full-bodied wine. Passion fruit and snap pea notes combine with citrus zest on the nose, palate and long, mouthwatering finish.
title: Neudorf 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

description: Piercing aromas of char and creosote are like a laser pop surrounded by a note of blackberry. This is raw, tannic and hard on the palate. Chunky berry flavors are heavily oaked, while this is jammy in feel and tastes of blueberry on the finish. Drink through 2021.
designation: Terroir Series Finca Coletto Single Vineyard
title: Trapiche 2012 Terroir Series Finca Coletto Single Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)

description: Ripe berry fruit and gritty oak aromas lead to a full-bodied blocky palate with grating tannins. This is a heavily oaked blend of Syrah, Tempranillo and Merlot. Flavors of blackberry, vanilla and wood spice finish with barrel char and depth. Drink through 2023.
title: Venta del Puerto 2013 No. 12 Selección Especial Red (Valencia)

description: A dry style with just enough acid to lend focus and length, this is a fine effort from Simon Waghorn, the owner-winemaker. Hints of baking spices and ginger lend nuance to the apple, pear, melon and citrus fruit.
title: Astrolabe 2015 Province Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

description: Mild notes of tomato leaf accent this wine's refreshing white-grapefruit aromas and flavors. It's medium in body and dry, finishing long and elegant. Drink now.
title: Box O'Birds 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Delicately scented, this offers yellow stone-fruit and citrus aromas. The bright, savory palate mirrors the nose, offering ripe yellow-peach, nectarine and golden apple flavors, while tangy acidity provides balance and freshness.
title: Jermann 2015 Vinnae White (Venezia Giulia)

description: From the mountains above the winery, this blends 39% Cabernet Sauvignon, 34% Cabernet Franc, 24% Petit Verdot and 3% Malbec. The result is a harmonious palate of dried herb, cedar and pungent violet flavors. Full-bodied concentration makes it rugged, accented with toasted oak.
title: Kunde 2013 Red (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

description: This wine's yellow flower, Mediterranean brush and citrus aromas will grab your attention. On the full-bodied palate, a white almond note underscores ripe Bartlett pear, nectarine and candied lemon flavors while a mineral note energizes the finish.
title: Le Masciare 2015  Fiano di Avellino

description: This wine leads with the fruity scent of fresh Conference and yellow pear. Its slightly spritzy palate comes with some yeasty, herbal savoriness and finishes fresh and dry.
title: Loimer 2016 Lois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: Although not super complex, this wine offers a great taste of little used grapes like Counoise and Cinsault. A sharp red cinnamon spice note kicks off the nose, with rose petal and cranberry scents that follow. The palate offers candied sour cherry and peppercorn flavors.
title: Lone Madrone 2014 La Mezcla Roja Red (Paso Robles)

description: This traditional method  sparkler opens with a genteel toastiness on the nose and palate. Fresh and bright fruit flavors suggest apples dusted with cinnamon. It's vintage dated and sourced from a single vineyard. Beware when opening–the cork virtually exploded from the bottle as soon as the capsule was loosened!
title: Lundeen 2012 Extra Brut Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

description: Scratchy and dry on the nose, this turns lean and borderline sour in the mouth, with acidity running the show. Very zesty, with mild oak influence, this is a blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Carmenère.
title: Indomita 2009 Duette Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: This Bordeaux-style blend—with an addition of Mourvèdre—is soft, simple and cloying, with vegetal flavors alongside the sweet raspberry jam note. High alcohol makes for a hot mouthfeel.
title: Hug 2008 el Conquistador Red (Paso Robles)

description: This has enormously high alcohol, but the fruit is curiously thin, with some unripeness. The amount of new oak doesn't seem to help.
title: Hug 2010 Starr Ranch Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This shows green unripe notes that go beyond gooseberry. Still, it gets a pass for cleanness and dryness.
title: Franciscan 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Aggressive on the palate, this has harp acids that frame flavors of sour cherry candy and green mint.
title: Grove Ridge 2011 Merlot (California)

description: This is charred and burnt smelling, with a rubbery, hickory aroma that covers up the wine's cherry and berry scents. The palate bears flavors of raspberry, pie cherry and green herb, finishing quick as a flash, with tannic residue.
title: Casa Silva 2009 Angostura Gran Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: A big letdown after the 2009, this is a simple, rustic wine. It's dry and acidic, with thin berry, herb and spice flavors.
title: Ugly Duckling 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Basic citrus and apple aromas lead to a round palate that won't stay fresh for much longer. It tastes melony and green, with lettuce flavors and a flat finish.
title: Viña La Rosa 2011 La Palma Sauvignon Blanc (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Somewhat underripe, this Bordeaux-style blend has modest cherry and boiled asparagus flavors.
title: Cielo Malibu Estate Vineyards 2008 Rouge Red (Saddle Rock-Malibu)

description: A soft, simple wine, with apricot and orange flavors that are quite sweet. Unless you like this style, you'll find it cloying.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is nearly indistinguishable from Arauco's standard 82-point 2011 Sauvignon Blanc, smelling stalky, with zero pungency or varietal character. It shows lemony acids, but that's about all.
title: Arauco 2011 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: This is sweet and simple, but its slight burn on the finish makes it harder to swallow.
title: flipflop NV Headshrinker Sweet Red Blend Red (California)

description: Other than notes of white flowers and green herbs on the nose, this wine is all about canned peas and beans. The palate has texture and flesh, but the flavors are vegetal.
title: Santa Ema 2011 Selected Terroir Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: This is hot in alcohol, and it has a vegetal note, with modest berry fruit. The finish seems sweet—like cola.
title: Hug 2010 el Magnifico Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: Peju's Sauvignon Blancs need warm vintages to succeed, and 2011 was anything but warm. The wine tastes unripe, with skunky aromas and flavors that make it difficult to like.
title: Peju 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: This is acidic and sweet, with a medicinal taste.
title: Bryter 2009 Hayley Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This is oily and strained on the nose and fleshy in the mouth. It tastes herbal and quasi weedy, with a matchstick note on the finish.
title: Viña el Aromo 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: This tastes barely ripe, with a vegetal flavor compromsing the chocolate and cherry notes. It's soft, making it fall a little flat in the mouth.
title: Muscardini 2009 Gracie Creek Vineyards Syrah (Sonoma Valley)

description: Another fabulous Cardinale, better than the 2007 but short of the perfect 2006. This is so complete; it tastes like Cabernet on a cloud, light but ethereal, with ripe, polished blackberry and cherry flavors and touches of mocha, spice and cedar. The tannins are a wonder—soft and pliant—yet gorgeously complex. Drink now-2016, at least.
title: Cardinale 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: We can quibble over whether the cherries are red or black, or if it's persimmons or pomegranates, or if the mushrooms are fresh or sautéed, but that's the point. This wine is so complex, it initiates discussion. Fine acidity and rich tannins provide structure, and although the wine is silky enough to enjoy now, you really want to give it 6–8 years.
title: Rochioli 2010 West Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine takes you on a trip to an outer wine world where deep, cushioned berry aromas come with exotic perfumes, bath oils and crushed flower petals. It's ultrasaturated and jammy, but not clunky or heavy. This tastes like a storm of blackberry, espresso and Swiss chocolate, while black spices and length bring up the rear. A blend of 50% Malbec, 40% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Cab Franc; drink now–2017.
title: Riglos 2009 Gran Corte Las Divas Vineyard Red (Tupungato)

description: Young and succulent, this is fresh, with ripe flavors of blackberries, cassis, chocolate and herb, with a toasty overlay of oak. Powerful, but not overbearing, this shows an internal coherence that lifts it to a high level of elegant complexity. As good as it is, it will benefit from 8-12 years in a proper cellar.
title: Celani Family Vineyards 2008 Ardore Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is dry and brisk in acidity, with firm tannins and great structural integrity. At the same time, it's vast in blackberry and cherry-jam flavors, while the oak overlay is strong but perfectly matched with the wine's volume. Very fine, complex and elegant, this is a Cabernet to cellar for eight years; it could be one for the long haul.
title: Laird 2009 Flat Rock Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: With its concentration and dark tannins, this is a wine that will need many years of aging. It is a serious combination of great style and great power. From one of the top Douro vineyards, this is a wine with an impressive, long-lasting sense of presence.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2009 Red (Douro)

description: Warm spice and oak tones accent fresh apples and lemons on this full-bodied Chardonnay. It's not subtle with a dense slick of caramel that extends along the midpalate, but a kick of lemon-lime acidity on the finish adds some levity.
title: McGregor 2012 Reserve Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

description: Aromas of freshly cracked pepper and boysenberry introduce this wine. Once sipped, the promised complexity slips away, with plum flavors and even tannins but not much lingering finish. Serve with burgers and meatloaf.
title: McIntyre Vineyards 2012 Kimberly Merlot (Arroyo Seco)

description: Sourced entirely from the Benches vineyard, this screw-capped wine shows a lot of SO2 when first opened, so plan on decanting if at all possible. Once it clears up it's a leesy, fresh white wine with flavors of apples and pears, lightly dusted with cinnamon spice.
title: Nine Hats 2013 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The alcohol has dropped to just above 12% in this vintage, and the wine seems a tad underripe. Overtly grassy and pungent, it suggests with petrol, gooseberry and green banana. Drink it well-chilled.
title: Airfield Estates 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

description: This funky white from the island of Mallorca is 50% Premsal and 50% Callet, and if you've never heard of those grapes you're not alone. The nose is a bit harsh and strange, while the palate is on the flat side. Flavors of ham, pithy citrus and nectarine finish jumbled. This is more of a unique oddity than great white wine.
title: Ànima Negra 2013 Quíbia Falanis White (Vi de la Terra Mallorca)

description: Roasted, slightly stalky aromas override the wine's traditional dry fruit and tomato scents. This is tight in the mouth, with grip and firm acidity. Flavors of tomato, herbs, roasted plum and spice finish with lasting herbal notes and a good texture. This contains 20% Graciano along with Tempranillo.
title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2009 Rioja Bordón Crianza  (Rioja)

description: Showing its wood strongly, this toasty wine seems to have lost the fruit. Some attractive acidity at the end helps compensate. Drink now.
title: Bret Brothers 2012 Les Mûres  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: Spritzy, lively and quite dry, this mixes citrus rind phenolics with apple and pear fruit. It's simple, fruity and searingly tart.
title: Buddha Kat 2013 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Light pepper, cassis and a hint of leather form the nose on this wine from a brand founded in 1994 specifically to deliver quality wines at affordable prices. The palate offers grilled meat and roasted root-vegetable flavors. Fairly gripping tannins mean that this wine could survive through 2017.
title: Castle Rock 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This dense Aglianico opens with aromas that recall resin, nail polish remover, stewed plum and chocolate. The meaty palate offers overripe black cherry and prune alongside aggressive tannins but it's evolved and shy on freshness. It finishes abruptly, with an astringent, tannic close.
title: Sanpaolo 2008 Aglianico (Irpinia)

description: Smoke and crushed granite lend a mineral tone to bright raspberry and cherry notes on this concentrated, juicy Pinot Noir. Sour cherry and red currant penetrate the palate, extending to a slightly astringent finish. Drink now to enjoy its youthful, fruity character.
title: Shalestone 2012 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

description: A wisp of smoke lends nuance to aromas of apple and white peach on this dry, refreshingly citric Chardonnay. The palate builds in bulk and body with concentrated flavors of savory apples layered in smoke and earth. Drink now.
title: Silver Thread 2012 Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

description: Fresh and fruity, this crisp wine comes from a region near Chablis. Good acidity, lively citrus and a cool feel all work well together.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2011  Bourgogne Vézelay

description: This unpretentious wine has a light fragrance of blue flower and black berry, while the simple palate offers fleeting black cherry flavors.
title: TerrAmore 2013 Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

description: This thick, extracted wine is made from 70% Pallagrello and 30% Casavecchia grapes, a portion of which was overripened on the vine. It opens with aromas of leafy underbrush, oak, toast, prune and vanilla. The lumbering, monolithic palate is sugary-sweet, offering vanilla extract, toasted oak and sugar plum.
title: Terre del Principe 2010 Piancastelli Red (Terre del Volturno)

description: This tangy rosé opens with a burst of tart strawberry fruit, and rolls into a lightly creamy midpalate. It's in the peppery, tannic style of rosé, making it a good match for more substantial foods.
title: Three Rivers 2013 Rosé Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This wine opens with aromas of sawdust, oak, tire rubber, coffee and mature black fruit. The palate is also dominated by wood sensations, offering oak extract, roasted coffee bean, vanilla and espresso that smother the hints of ripe black plum that peek through.
title: Vestini Campagnano 2011 Pallagrello Nero (Terre del Volturno)

description: The wine is soft, fruity and ready to drink, with attractive fruitiness, soft acidity and a touch of wood. With a crisp aftertaste, it offers freshness as well.
title: Clos des Rocs 2012 Clos des Rocs Monopole  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: A tight, mineral-driven wine, it has both great fruit and acidity. It is tangy, pushing forward crisp lemon and apple skin flavors and a touch of peach. Drink now.
title: Collovray et Terrier 2012 Les Vignes de Joanny  (Mâcon-Davayé)

description: A juicy blend of Nero d'Avola and Nerello Mascalese, this wine offers blackberry and black cherry flavors in a friendly, easy-drinking style. It's perfect for everyday dinners and informal occasions.
title: Corvo 2012 Rosso Red (Terre Siciliane)

description: Made from organically grown grapes, this opens with earthy aromas of tilled earth and ripe black fruit. The simple, one-dimensional palate delivers mature blackberry and plum alongside a fleeting note of black pepper. Enjoy soon.
title: Di Giovanna 2012 Poggionotte Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

description: This wine is 100% varietal and fermented and aged in stainless steel. It starts out quite reductive before opening to reveal perfumed notes of rose petal, lychee and spice. The palate is off dry (16g/L residual sugar), broad and oily in feel.
title: Domaine Pouillon 2013 Jewett Creek Vineyards Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

description: A deeply golden Chardonnay from E & J Gallo's Edna Valley brand, this wine starts with a tightly wound nose, faintly offering tart apple, lemon rind and a slight herbal character. An elegant but brief flavor of perfumed pear washes away quickly without much finish.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2012 Fleur de Edna Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This Aglianico opens with aromas of new oak, vanilla, chocolate and overripe black fruit, all of which carry over to the one-dimensional palate. It seems tired, and the sugary sweetness, dense concentration and evident alcohol give the wine a lumbering character.
title: Fattoria La Rivolta 2009 Terre di Rivolta Riserva  (Aglianico del Taburno)

description: Here is a steely, bright Sauvignon Blanc that's rounded in citrus, melon and herbal flavors, finishing clean and with ample acidic lift.
title: Foppiano 2012 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: Tannic and earthy, it falls on the dark, herbal side, cloaking its cassis fruit in flavors of tannin and stem. It's best drunk with grilled meats, or a good, greasy pizza.
title: Girly Girl 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Mild, innocuous aromas of white fruits are pleasant but undefined. This feels round and benefits from acidic lift, while flavors of orange and nectarine finish in a friendly manner. This is mostly Viura with some Verdejo and Sauvignon Blanc.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Hedonismo 2012 Blanco White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Stalky aromas infiltrate schisty plum and berry scents, while in the mouth this Garnacha-led blend of five grapes is jammy feeling. Stalky, roasted berry flavors are strong, while the finish is stalky tasting and gritty in feel.
title: Clos Gebrat 2011 Red (Priorat)

description: This is black as night, concentrated and shows aromas of asphalt, lemon peel and blackberry. The palate is round and soft, with mellow tannins. The flavor profile is very ripe and focuses on prune and blackberry, while the finish is loamy in feel, with a licorice hint.
title: Felix Callejo 2011 Flores de Callejo  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Fleshy and ripe with flavors of sweet yellow peach touched with honey, this is an easy going medium-sweet Riesling. There's a touch of savory smoke and spice that persists from nose to finish, but overall, it's bright and sunny with lingering lemon acidity.
title: Wagner 2012 Select Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Powerfully structured and concentrated, this is a rich, tarry and tannic wine. The dense texture doesn't lose sight of the jammy black currant and berry fruits that are just underneath. For the moment, even after four years, the wine is very young, firm and dry. Drink from 2018.
title: Casa da Passarella 2011 Abanico Reserva Red (Dão)

description: Is there any doubt that 2012 is a superb vintage for South Australian Shiraz? Here's another fine example, boasting sumptuous levels of black cherry fruit framed by hints of brown sugar, roasted meat, cinnamon and allspice. It's full-bodied and richly textured, with a long, velvety finish. Drink 2018–2030.
title: Kangarilla Road 2012 The Devil's Whiskers Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: On top of being made from organically grown grapes, this wine is vegan friendly. Of course, that means nothing unless the wine is good. Thankfully, this wine is excellent. Apricot, honey and ginger notes mingle easily on the palate. Drink this full-bodied, slightly open-knit wine over through 2017.
title: Yalumba 2014 Made with Organic Grapes Viognier (South Australia)

description: A compelling effort, stylish and dark, this has a crisp minerality that underpins fruit flavors of black cherry, fig and plum. The texture, length and definition are first-rate.
title: Grizzly Peak 2012 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

description: It's rare to find a Sémillon in Portugal, let along the Alentejo. And yet the wine works beautifully. Wood aging has given it sophistication while the natural creamy texture of the grape is enhanced by the ripe yellow fruits that are lightly lifted by a herbal, citrus aftertaste. This wine could well age, so drink now or, better, keep until 2017.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2014 Esporão Private Selection White White (Alentejano)

description: A seductive smoky, earthy aroma leads to big and tart cranberry and raspberry flavors, surrounded by a velvety blanket of fine tannins that make the wine lip-smacking and mouthwatering. There is somewhat more frame than filling, so this will appeal more to fans of tension and elegance than power.
title: Hirsch 2012 Block 8 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Pure notes of tart but ripe, red apple shine on nose and palate. They pervade this fresh, clean and dry wine with immense, appetizing juiciness. There is concentration and joy at the heart, backed by focussed, taut acidity that brightens everything. The lemon zest on the finish is impressive and long.
title: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2013 Wineck-Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Honeysuckle spice wraps itself around luscious, ripe, sweet peach fruit. The sweet palate reinforces this aromatic duo. This is fluid and round, indulgent and rich, but inflected with charming orange peel freshness.
title: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2011 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: This wine has pleasing richness, lending warmth across a full palate. Forward berry and cherry flavors fill the mouth, offering an accessible burst of fresh flavor in a somewhat blocky frame. There's a jolt of spice and a streak of cola, all quite tasty. The wine spent 19 months in 53% new French oak.
title: Cristom 2012 Sommers Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Pretty is the word that comes to mind upon sniffing and sipping this wine, with its beguiling strawberry and cherry fruit. It gathers strength in its core, while maintaining an elegant, well-structured acid/tannin frame. It's an outstanding value in Oregon Pinot from a top producer.
title: Cristom 2013 Mount Jefferson Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Faint rose petal notes still perfume the peachy fruit. The palate is rich, medium sweet and honeyed, as though peach and citrus were soaked in honey. This is fresh and rich, rounded and poised, tipping the scales just a little bit more on the rich side. The spice on the finish is reminiscent of honeysuckle.
title: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2011 Steingrubler Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: The bitter-sweet edge of dark fir honey engulfs nose and palate which nonetheless has a core of bright, ripe, juicy and slightly sweet pear. The sweetness sings with that bitter tinge. This is rich but fresh and balanced and leaves with an off-dry aftertaste of more honey.
title: Domaine Fernand Engel 2013 Gloeckelberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: Produced from vines located between Chavignol and Sancerre, this comes from pure chalk soil. It is crisp while having a warmer, more rounded character. It's full of apple and pineapple as well as citrus fruits which are added to the young, tight mineral texture. Aromatic and ripe, the wine should age a year or two and will be better from 2017.
title: Domaine Laporte 2014 La Comtesse  (Sancerre)

description: Broad berry/cherry fruit flavors open up quickly, with lighter accents of compost and leather. This is a smooth, somewhat loose-knit wine, with pretty baking spices decorating the finish.
title: Domaine Serene 2012 Two Barns Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The current edition of this nonvintage rosé is a blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. Bone-dry, tart and tangy, it's a versatile, food-friendly wine, with flavors of tart citrus flesh and rind. A dash of white pepper marks the long, full-bodied finish.
title: Domaine Serene NV R Dry Rosé (Oregon)

description: With a nutty flavor fresh apples and pears and a touch of honey, this is a delicious wine. It is full of ripe fruit that has not lost its crisp, cool character. The wine has a mineral edge that gives it a fine tang as well as a tight texture. It's fresh although there are indications of bottle age which means it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Vincent Carême 2013 L'Ancestrale Brut  (Vouvray)

description: Minerality takes center stage in this light-footed but penetrating dry Riesling. While the fruit profile is zesty and green—suggesting tart, under-ripe lime, tangerines and melon rinds—the palate is gilded by slick layers of candlewax and petrol, lending a dense, voluminous mouthfeel. It's an elegant, stately wine to drink now through 2023.
title: Dr. Bürklin-Wolf 2014 Wachenheimer Böhling P.C. Dry Riesling (Pfalz)

description: More blossomy and mineral than ripe or ruddy, there's a demure elegance to this bristling off-dry Riesling. Crisp, almost crystalline flavors of tangerine and yellow peach accentuate and lengthen the palate. It's a deftly cutting wine to drink now through 2020.
title: Dr. Loosen 2014 Bernkasteler Lay Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: This tiny winery burst on the scene when its 2010 Cabernet scooped three trophies at the Margaret River Wine Show. This wine does show more weight and richness than the 2012, with a silky, satiny texture rarely found in young Cabernet Sauvignon and crisp, cassis-inflected fruit. Drink now–2030.
title: Cloudburst 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)

description: Wide streaks of saffron, caramel and honey along with a deep mineral core hint to the maturity of this complex sparkling Riesling. Rich yellow cherry and peach flavors persist on the palate, buoyed by soft, delicate mousse and striking lemonade acidity.
title: Max Ferd. Richter 2008 Mülheimer Sonnenlay Brut Sekt Riesling (Mosel)

description: Violet red in the glass, this wine features a bouquet of cherry, violet and vanilla. Flavors of cherry, blueberry, anise, ground black pepper and green bell pepper are fixed in a framework of tannins that offer full mouthfeel right into the orange peel finish.
title: Pelter 2013 Matar Petit Verdot (Jerusalem Hills)

description: This fragrant, musky wine is scented with dried rose petals, spiced cranberries, pepper and chocolate. It rolls comfortably into a full-bodied core with cherry cobbler, medium length and polished tannins.
title: Penner-Ash 2013 Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: Right away, this smells smooth and complete, with a proper mix of berry fruit, oak and earthy aromas. This is Salentein winemaker José Galante's personal wine, and it's juicy on the palate and doesn't overreach. Blackberry, boysenberry and salty, meaty notes finish with a persistent dose of salt, which should make this all the more appropriate when served with beef. Drink through 2022.
title: Puramun 2013 Reserva Malbec (Valle de Uco)

description: The wine is ripe, still young with its fresh fruits and acidity. The elements are all there to produce a dark and dense wine that has fine structure. It's a complex blend of Alfrocheiro, Syrah and Touriga Nacional, all of which will allow the wine to age over a good few years. Drink this impressive wine from 2017.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2013 Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This pure Arinto from its home territory is fresh, fruity, citrus-driven and with apple and textured zesty orange flavors. The wine has structure, intense acidity and a tangy, mineral character that will allow it to mature a few more months. Drink now, but better from late 2016.
title: Quinta da Romeira 2013 Morgado de Santa Catherina Reserva Arinto (Bucelas)

description: Almost black in color, this is a hugely dense, dark wine. It brings out the tannic side of the grape with hints of black coffee and dark chocolate. Under all this concentration, there is some fruit that is still waiting to get out: black plum and black currants with fresh acidity. Just wait until 2017.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2011 Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: Lovely scents of orchard fruit, citrus, almond blossom and a whiff of light baking spice emerge on this radiant wine. The lively, balanced palate delivers yellow apple, bitter almond, ginger and a note of tangerine zest. A salty note closes the finish.
title: Raccaro 2014 Friulano (Collio)

description: Made with 80% Chardonnay and 20% Friulano, this amber-colored wine boasts more fruit richness than many other wines from the orange wine movement. Loaded with ripe apricot, candied citrus zest, dried herbs and crushed stone, this is brightened by lively acidity on the palate. A perfect introduction to the genre; Drink now–2016.
title: Radikon 2012 Slatnik White (Venezia Giulia)

description: A foundation of thick tannin and oak give size and weight to this full-bodied wine that offers waves of smoky leather, cedar, tar and black cherry on the nose and palate. More savory than fruity, it is a compelling expression of this relatively cooler appellation in the Napa Valley. Drink now through 2020.
title: Rocca 2012 Collinetta Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

description: This wine opens in classically delicate characteristics of clove and cedar, as expressive as a forest floor. It then unveils a combination of red and black plum deftly sifted through soft layers of integrated oak and tannin.
title: Rocca 2012 Grigsby Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)

description: Rich wine showing all the spicy character that comes with Gewurztraminer. It is on the dry side while having some softness from its lychee perfumes. Fine as an apéritif or with pâté and Chinese food. Screwcap.
title: René Sparr 2011 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: Despite being fairly young, this is a weighty wine with a gold color and waxy apple aromas. A blocky mouthfeel is oily and has enough acidity to stay lively. Flavors of chunky apple, peach and melon lead to a round, oily feeling finish.
title: Marko 2011 Kortezubi Urdaibai Hondarrabi Zuri (Bizkaiko Txakolina)

description: A little rough around the edges, but otherwise a soft, juicy wine for drinking now. It has pleasant cherry pie and ripe red-currant fruit flavors. Air it in a decanter or in the glass for an hour before drinking.
title: V. Sattui 2010 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: An upfront aroma of red currant leads the bouquet of this wine, with a secondary hint of bell pepper that carries over to the palate. It has a tight core of red cherry and raspberry flavors alongside some green vegetal notes and brash tannins.
title: Valiano 2010  Chianti Classico

description: Sharply herbal, this shows a bit of a green edge, which comes across as bitterness on the finish. The pale red-fruit flavors hint at thistle and bramble more than ripe berry, but the balance is there to carry the wine well with food.
title: Edwin Dyer 2011 Le Cadeau Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Made in a family winery based in San Francisco that sources fruit mainly from Lodi, this Sauvignon Blanc is rich with fig and Nilla Wafer notes, with a pretty, floral nose.
title: Eristavi Winery 2012 Vintner's Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: This is a fruity, wood-aged wine, showing spice and coffee flavors that complement ripe blackberry fruit. It's smooth in texture and has just the right touch of acidity. The wine is ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: Fiuza 2012 Native Tinto Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: Considering the coolness of the vintage, this wine seems surprisingly ripe with notes of cherry, strawberry, herbs and ash. It's thick and weighty in feel, making it seem a bit ponderous.
title: Foris 2011 Maple Ranch Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)

description: Coming from the warm, dry 2012 vintage, this is straight down the fairway with notes of apple, pear and herbs, with the alcohol providing some distraction on the finish.
title: Foris 2012 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

description: Lavish barrel fermentation, aging in new French oak and sur lie stirring was intended to bring out a Bordeaux-style richness in this wine. But the chilly vintage intervened, yielding a wine with dominant green peppercorn aromas and flavors. Still, it's a subtle, elegant wine. Drink now.
title: Lancaster 2012 Samantha's Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

description: This has aromas of toasted oak, espresso and spice that carry over to the palate along with dark fruit undertones. It's lean and linear without enough rich fruit to carry the assertive oak.
title: Lornano 2010  Chianti Classico

description: Fragrant wine, attractively perfumed, crisply fresh. It is full of ripe apples, layered with intense acidity and balanced with a warmer peach flavor. Ready to drink.
title: Louis Sipp NV Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: This leads with violet, berry and chocolate aromas, followed by plum and black cherry flavors laced with hints of espresso. It's simply structured with fresh acidity and solid tannins.
title: Agricoltori del Chianti Geografico 2010  Chianti Classico

description: This barrique-aged Chianti Classico shows cherry and espresso aromas. It has very ripe cherry and raspberry flavors that are just shy of overripe, along with vanilla and coffee notes. You'll also find drying wood tannins that cut the palate short. David Bowler Wines, Lemma Wine Company.
title: Candialle 2010  Chianti Classico

description: Greg Graziano blends 81% Sauvignon Blanc and 19% Pinot Grigio for a dynamite combination of tropical guava flavor, bracing acidity, and a pronounced hit of grapefruit on the finish.
title: Graziano 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

description: Black fruit, clove, char and mocha are the primary aromas on this heavily oaked, saturated Monastrell. The palate shows bullish tannins, bold acids and weight, while dark-leaning flavors of blackberry, stewed plum and mint come with enough acidity to cut through the wine's fat and oak.
title: Hilanda 2009 Término de Arriba Monastrell (Jumilla)

description: Its brisk acidity and dry, tart lemon-and-lime flavors make this a nice wine to drink now. It has the herb and tobacco notes you often find in Napa Valley Chardonnay.
title: Hill Wine Company 2011 Black Dog Series Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Very creamy mousse leads to a tight wine with raspberry flavors and considerable acidity. That makes the wine very fresh, crisp, clean with an attractive final fragrance. It's ready to drink but could have a few months' bottle age.
title: Cave de Cleebourg NV Clérotstein Rosé Brut Pinot Noir (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Fragrant and fruity, this is a bright, crisp and clean wine that's totally ready to drink. Lively, with a cool feeling like the nearby ocean's breezes, it finishes with light acidity.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Coreto Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Made with organic grapes, this internationally-styled wine is still very much on its oak and is dominated by toasted wood, coffee and espresso sensations. Although the palate also shows a ripe plum flavor, it has an abrupt finish from drying wood tannins.
title: Querciabella 2010  Chianti Classico

description: Spice notes from wood aging gives this wine a rounded character. Ripe berry fruits show strongly so drink soon while its fruitiness lasts. Screwcap.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2011 Espirito Tinto Red (Tejo)
